commit_message:
Magnum::Bay observe reality implementation

Override parse_live_resource_data method for Magnum::Bay resource
to observe and update resource plugin with live state.
Also, default values for node_count and master_count were added,
because if a user doesn't set them we decide that there is a diff
between heat properties and reality and send unnecessary update.

implements bp get-reality-for-resources

Change-Id: I2cd19fe7b88b4e24798a3baf7cfa3c0ec2cccbb2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/96/305396/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def parse_live_resource_data(self, resource_properties, resource_data): record_reality = {} properties_keys = list( set(self.PROPERTIES) - { self.NAME, self.BAYMODEL, self.DISCOVERY_URL, self.BAY_CREATE_TIMEOUT}) for key in properties_keys: record_reality.update({key: resource_data.get(key)}) return record_reality

commit_message:
Use values from endpoint map for service endpoints

Instead of using values hardcoded in os-cloud-config. This commit
uses the values that come from the endpoint map that's used
in the t-h-t. This in turns, allows us to be able to change the
port and even the host used for the public and internal endpoints;
this is still not the case for the admin endpoints, as it is based
on the internal endpoint of the service. The aforementioned
limitation comes from os-cloud-config.

Change-Id: I0cf9ada1110f6b1452480039c136aee1fc3ccc82
Depends-On: I4cc5bbf2e7200f78cd90b93659c326a9200278d7
Depends-On: I07accff0914b93be09adf17a2552c5c922236c2e
(cherry picked from commit d67ccaf7baf7beb7ea3559c84ae0c645d0452dd8)

added_lines: parsed_args, stack): keystone_admin_ip = utils.get_endpoint('KeystoneAdmin', stack) keystone_internal_ip = utils.get_endpoint('KeystoneInternal', stack) # NOTE(jaosorior): These ports will be None if the templates # don't support the EndpointMap as an output yet. And so the # default values will be taken. public_port = None admin_port = None internal_port = None endpoint_map = utils.get_endpoint_map(stack) if endpoint_map: public_port = endpoint_map.get('KeystonePublic').get('port') admin_port = endpoint_map.get('KeystoneAdmin').get('port') internal_port = endpoint_map.get( 'KeystoneInternal').get('port') internal=keystone_internal_ip, public_port=public_port, admin_port=admin_port, internal_port=internal_port) service_data = self._set_service_data(service, data, stack) if service_data: services.update({service: service_data}) def _set_service_data(self, service, data, stack): self.log.debug("Setting data for service '%s'" % service) service_data = data.copy() service_data.pop('password_field', None) endpoint_map = utils.get_endpoint_map(stack) try: service_data.update( self._get_base_service_data(service, data, stack)) except KeyError: output_source = "service IPs" if endpoint_map: output_source = "endpoint map" self.log.warning( ("Skipping \"{}\" postconfig because it wasn't found in the " "{} output").format(service, output_source)) return None if not endpoint_map: return service_data service_data.update(self._get_endpoint_data(service, endpoint_map, stack)) return service_data def _get_base_service_data(self, service, data, stack): service_data = {} password_field = data.get('password_field') if password_field: service_data['password'] = utils.get_password( password_field) # Set internal endpoint service_name_internal = self._format_endpoint_name(service, 'internal') service_data['internal_host'] = utils.get_endpoint( service_name_internal, stack) return service_data def _get_endpoint_data(self, service, endpoint_map, stack): endpoint_data = {} # Set SSL port if public_endpoint_data['uri'].startswith('https'): endpoint_data['ssl_port'] = public_endpoint_data['port'] return endpoint_data def _format_endpoint_name(self, service, interface): return re.sub('v[0-9]+', '', service.capitalize() + interface.capitalize()) parsed_args, stack) # Force fetching of attributes stack.get()

commit_message:
Provide single step check if eventlet is monkey_patched

Currently to perform such check we need to check if eventlet
is available first, that give us two steps, but it is
desired to check this at once.

This change is to remove the function here:
[1] https://github.com/openstack/oslo.messaging/blob/master/oslo_messaging/_drivers/pika_driver/pika_commons.py#L37
Also will be useful in zmq-driver.

Change-Id: Ie24ecb54946bfba465d293185ebfda25691a8701
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.utils refs/changes/53/304053/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def is_eventlet_monkey_patched(module): """Determines safely is eventlet patching for module enabled or not :param module: String, module name :return Bool, True if module is patched, False otherwise """ if not _patcher: return False return _patcher.is_monkey_patched(module)

commit_message:
Add installation support for os_ironic

This patch adds the initial support for the ironic role in
openstack-ansible, but leaves ironic unconfigured and not
installed by default.

Configuration, including Nova configuration, will be addressed in
subsequent patches.

Change-Id: Id9f01deb5c46ee2186b9c41c7f88205560b5f437
Depends-On: Ide66c7ee59192ac441ac2919028eca0ad665ceea
Depends-On: I590f5ade90b3e37af7f1b8ee333000d4f993f8c5
Partially-implements: blueprint role-ironic
Signed-off-by: Michael Davies <michael@the-davies.net>
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Doc: fix flannel etcd key

In flanneld version 0.5.4(on fedora-atomic-23 iamge), the default flannel
etcd key changed from /coreos.com/network to /atomic.io/network.

Use $FLANNEL_ETCD_KEY in /etc/sysconfig/flanneld for debugging.

Change-Id: I13e26061b7a6b33878f90834eacde9c4bc6e72d7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/magnum refs/changes/89/302589/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: . /etc/sysconfig/flanneld etcdctl get $FLANNEL_ETCD_KEY/config . /etc/sysconfig/flanneld for s in `etcdctl ls $FLANNEL_ETCD_KEY/subnets` /atomic.io/network/subnets/10.100.14.0-24 /atomic.io/network/subnets/10.100.61.0-24 /atomic.io/network/subnets/10.100.92.0-24
deleted_lines: etcdctl get /coreos.com/network/config for s in `etcdctl ls /coreos.com/network/subnets` /coreos.com/network/subnets/10.100.14.0-24 /coreos.com/network/subnets/10.100.61.0-24 /coreos.com/network/subnets/10.100.92.0-24

commit_message:
Moved -t parameter for visibility

When called without the required arguments, the allowed arguments are
output to the screen. The order of those arguments is dictated by when
they are added to the parser.

Before this change, -t (a required parameter) was at the start of the
list. This obfuscated the required parameter list when the help output
was displayed:

usage: openstack stack create [-h]
                              [-f
{html,json,json,shell,table,value,yaml,yaml}]
                              [-c COLUMN] [--max-width <integer>]
[--noindent]
                              [--prefix PREFIX] -t <template>
                              [-e <environment>] [--timeout <timeout>]
                              [--pre-create <resource>]
[--enable-rollback]
                              [--parameter <key=value>]
                              [--parameter-file <key=file>] [--wait]
                              [--tags <tag1,tag2...>] [--dry-run]
                              <stack-name>

Notice how the -t appears in the middle of the optional arguments. This
change moves it to the end so that it is more easily visible to the user
what is required:

usage: openstack stack create [-h]
                              [-f
{html,json,json,shell,table,value,yaml,yaml}]
                              [-c COLUMN] [--max-width <integer>]
[--noindent]
                              [--prefix PREFIX] [-e <environment>]
                              [--timeout <timeout>] [--pre-create
<resource>]
                              [--enable-rollback] [--parameter
<key=value>]
                              [--parameter-file <key=file>] [--wait]
                              [--tags <tag1,tag2...>] [--dry-run]
                              -t <template>
                              <stack-name>

Change-Id: I4e17650622dc8e206dc1aa39e4102f16429ac353

commit_message:
Optionally allow autocomplete in Horizon

Horizon disables password autocompletion by default. This causes
problems for users who use password managers and want to store
their Horizon credentials. This patch adds a variable that allows
a deployer to override this default.

Release notes are included.

Change-Id: I8eaa5a1773e6f182c436b312f2733a21505a867c
Closes-Bug: 1570505
(cherry picked from commit 8667dce5e13af1bf59caf6b0025ee62ab4265933)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_horizon refs/changes/55/306055/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: HORIZON_CONFIG["password_autocomplete"] = "{{ (horizon_enable_password_autocomplete | bool) | ternary('on','off') }}"

commit_message:
cleanup-host should not remove kolla-build.conf

new cleanup-host script removes kolla-build.conf
in /etc/kolla directory which contains the build
configuration for building images.
This should be preserved.

Change-Id: I20fbf3f8a2400a5e048ba55beb0c8e1ec849d8a3
Related-Bug:#1561055
(cherry picked from commit 15444da4d990685ba4c954a78bea819d6706dc3b)

add it before the dependent module installation.

commit_message:
Drop use of neutron-plugin-metering-agent

As the minimum OpenStack release supported is now Icehouse
which provided the neutron-metering-agent package, switch
to using this by default for ovs and ovs-odl plugin types.

Resolves install failures for ovs-odl on Xenial/Mitaka where
the neutron-plugin-metering-agent transitional package has
been removed.

Change-Id: I431bef69b597bc9c55ed6f4c35552e6f1b707d30

subject: [swift-install] Correct advice about ownership of /etc/swift directory
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-29 04:09:49.000000000', 'files': ['doc/install-guide/source/swift-finalize-installation.rst'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals/commit/0f588ce29725a061c362fa29d4acc9b4d9dc92ca', 'message': "[swift-install] Correct advice about ownership of /etc/swift directory

This patch corrects ownership of /etc/swift directory from 'root:swift' to
'swift:swift' in swift finalize installation guide.

Change-Id: I8f58d6ca891033cf6d05ea1688b375eb80bdab3e
"}]
commit_message:
[swift-install] Correct advice about ownership of /etc/swift directory

This patch corrects ownership of /etc/swift directory from 'root:swift' to
'swift:swift' in swift finalize installation guide.

Change-Id: I8f58d6ca891033cf6d05ea1688b375eb80bdab3e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/20/298520/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # chown -R swift:swift /etc/swift # chown -R swift:swift /etc/swift # chown -R swift:swift /etc/swift
deleted_lines: # chown -R root:swift /etc/swift # chown -R root:swift /etc/swift # chown -R root:swift /etc/swift

commit_message:
Refactor neutron utils

- Remove deprecated code
- Refactor tests to avoid copy pasting and remove all
  warnings and exceptions from logs

Change-Id: I3c0347cd31316dd3a30eeae007da3e32270e45ef

subject: pki/fernet: write keystone-manage logs in new files
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-14 19:23:05.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/token_logs_file-d002e669303b0555.yaml', 'spec/classes/keystone_spec.rb', 'manifests/init.pp'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-keystone/commit/5f0cbf851b6b4cc21274d62e31618a5e02a69efd', 'message': "pki/fernet: write keystone-manage logs in new files

keystone-manage tool is not able yet [1] to write in a specific log file
or in syslog.
Until it's done in Keystone, change the way we run the Execs in Puppet
so we can redirect the output in the log files that we want.

Do it for both pki & fernet log files.

Note: a unit tests was duplicated, it has been replace by a new test for
PKI with non-default value for pki_logs_file.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/keystone/+bug/1570463

Change-Id: If5b54f183408acedc42ac5c3fdeb08df0cfa1e31
"}]
commit_message:
pki/fernet: write keystone-manage logs in new files

keystone-manage tool is not able yet [1] to write in a specific log file
or in syslog.
Until it's done in Keystone, change the way we run the Execs in Puppet
so we can redirect the output in the log files that we want.

Do it for both pki & fernet log files.

Note: a unit tests was duplicated, it has been replace by a new test for
PKI with non-default value for pki_logs_file.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/keystone/+bug/1570463

Change-Id: If5b54f183408acedc42ac5c3fdeb08df0cfa1e31
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-keystone refs/changes/44/306044/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # [*pki_logs_file*] # (Optional) Location for the pki logs file. # Defaults to '/var/lib/keystone/keystone-pki.log' ## [*fernet_logs_file*] # (Optional) Location for the fernet logs file. # Defaults to '/var/lib/keystone/keystone-fernet.log' # $fernet_logs_file = '/var/log/keystone/keystone-fernet.log', $pki_logs_file = '/var/log/keystone/keystone-pki.log', command => "keystone-manage pki_setup --keystone-user ${keystone_user} --keystone-group ${keystone_group} >>${pki_logs_file} 2>&1", command => "keystone-manage fernet_setup --keystone-user ${keystone_user} --keystone-group ${keystone_group} >>${fernet_logs_file} 2>&1",

commit_message:
Get revocation list with only audit ids

A new audit_id_only argument is added to get_revoked which if True
requests that the server return audit IDs and not token IDs.

Closes-Bug: 1317302
Change-Id: I6c40f1ed32f102006c881e80f9ef0025a9d8709b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-keystoneclient refs/changes/96/260196/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def get_revoked(self, audit_id_only=False): :param bool audit_id_only: If true, the server is requested to not send token IDs. :returns: A dict containing ``signed`` which is a CMS formatted string if the server signed the response. If `audit_id_only` then the response may be a dict containing ``revoked`` which is the list of token audit IDs and expiration times. path = '/auth/tokens/OS-PKI/revoked' if audit_id_only: path += '?audit_id_only' resp, body = self._client.get(path)
deleted_lines: def get_revoked(self): :returns: A dict containing "signed" which is a CMS formatted string. resp, body = self._client.get('/auth/tokens/OS-PKI/revoked')

commit_message:
Resolve Gate failure

Recent change in tempest of using urllib3 instead of httplib2
causing our gate to fail. This commit fixes the same.

Change-Id: Ia966cfaaeaff97bdc156c767ba39c7136328413f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/congress refs/changes/67/305767/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from urllib3.exceptions import MaxRetryError except MaxRetryError as e: LOG.debug("Replica server not ready") return False

subject: Add 169.254.169.254 when enable force_metadata
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-01 01:15:57.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/1263f625a5c3459de201dbe330661001f5a46fe3', 'message': 'Add 169.254.169.254 when enable force_metadata

When enable force_metadata in dhcp.ini, and create a network

commit_message:
Add 169.254.169.254 when enable force_metadata

When enable force_metadata in dhcp.ini, and create a network
and a subnet, none 169.254.169.254/24 ip info set in related
namespace(qdhcp-XXX) with `ip a` command. In this case, vms could
not get metadata any more.

Change-Id: Ib5b95f3afc6e66f66cdb7e1e98e5450a6e80a1b2
Closes-Bug: #1549793

subject: Include query string in request logging
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-14 19:41:45.000000000', 'files': ['keystoneauth1/session.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/keystoneauth/commit/33521221ce3212c387b092abecaba7e8cd395879', 'message': "Include query string in request logging

While debugging openstacksdk, I noticed that the way we send query
parameters in a request led to them not being included in the URL that
gets logged within _http_log_request. When the `url` directly includes
the query string, it of course gets logged. When a caller utilizes the
`params` argument (set to a dictionary of query parameters), which is
subsequently handled inside of the requests library, those parameters
don't end up getting logged.

This change grabs any query parameters out of the `params` argument and
sends them into the log method. The resulting output of a url with
included query strings is wrapped in double quotes so the CURL command
that gets logged is actually runnable, because the question mark
separator is interpreted by the shell.

Change-Id: I249ae29e0d60887c637e497133c2a134f38982b5
"}]
commit_message:
Include query string in request logging

While debugging openstacksdk, I noticed that the way we send query
parameters in a request led to them not being included in the URL that
gets logged within _http_log_request. When the `url` directly includes
the query string, it of course gets logged. When a caller utilizes the
`params` argument (set to a dictionary of query parameters), which is
subsequently handled inside of the requests library, those parameters
don't end up getting logged.

This change grabs any query parameters out of the `params` argument and
sends them into the log method. The resulting output of a url with
included query strings is wrapped in double quotes so the CURL command
that gets logged is actually runnable, because the question mark
separator is interpreted by the shell.

Change-Id: I249ae29e0d60887c637e497133c2a134f38982b5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystoneauth refs/changes/51/306051/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: json=None, headers=None, query_params=None, logger=_logger): if query_params: # Don't check against `is not None` as this can be # an empty dictionary, which we shouldn't bother logging. url = url + '?' + urllib.parse.urlencode(query_params) # URLs with query strings need to be wrapped in quotes in order # for the CURL command to run properly. string_parts.append('"%s"' % url) else: string_parts.append(url) # Query parameters that are included in the url string will # be logged properly, but those sent in the `params` parameter # (which the requests library handles) need to be explicitly # picked out so they can be included in the URL that gets loggged. query_params = kwargs.get('params', dict()) query_params=query_params,

commit_message:
Make apt_fuel logging more obvious

Existing output was often mistaken for an error.
Fix with pushing warning instead of error messages when retries are not
run out of.

Change-Id: I0e7ed2c591297f44e6690d8c3a73625b151ad3cf
Closes-bug: #1567339
(cherry picked from commit b481d50509816134cc1aac7f512b0799f1a72f0b)

commit_message:
Fix bug at creating subnet failed

Failed to create subnet at admin dashboard. An error as follow raise:

   Error: Failed to create subnet "XX.XX.XX.XX/XX" for network "None":
   Invalid input for network_id. Reason: 'None' is not a valid UUID.

Specify `network` argument when call `_create_subnet` method to fix
this bug.

Change-Id: Ifa52fa88ebb60fabc6695f41095c254016aa36eb
Closes-bug: #1512669
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/11/242311/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fix styles of table views

We should fix following styles in table views for Mitaka Horizon.
This patch fixes these styles according to following html file in
patch.

/openstack_dashboard/static/app/core/images/table/images-table.html
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/246625/

Except followings, because that needs to fix reorg actions.
- position of batch action buttons

Change-Id: I214a0672c8e5a517fb465427bbb83f19243b9489
Closes-Bug: #1553936

commit_message:
Friendlier error message with empty task file

This is particularly useful when a Jinja2 template results in an empty
task. The current error message isn't very helpful:

Task config is invalid: `'NoneType' object has no attribute 'get'`

Change-Id: If810ad1089c26be3c6117ff4a937944f941ef636
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/rally refs/changes/88/306088/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_init_empty_config(self, mock_task_config): config = None task = mock.Mock() exception = self.assertRaises(exceptions.InvalidTaskException, engine.TaskEngine, config, task) self.assertIn("Input task is empty", str(exception)) self.assertTrue(task.set_failed.called) @mock.patch("rally.task.engine.TaskConfig")

commit_message:
WIP - Emit failure notifications for CADF audits events

We currently emit audit events when some resources are created,
deleted, or updated. We should do the same for when that action
fails.

Closes-Bug: 1431987
Change-Id: I4df5b3a896d9c54cd036a1230f9357a34f7518ac
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/05/156905/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from keystone import exception def test_audit_failure_known_id(self): self.config_fixture.config(notification_format='cadf') resource_id = uuid.uuid4().hex self.assertRaises(exception.DomainNotFound, self.resource_api.delete_domain, resource_id) self._assert_last_audit(resource_id, DELETED_OPERATION, 'domain', cadftaxonomy.SECURITY_DOMAIN) self.assertTrue(len(self._audits) > 0) audit = self._audits[-1] payload = audit['payload'] self.assertEqual(cadftaxonomy.OUTCOME_FAILURE, payload['outcome']) def test_audit_failure_unknown_id(self): self.config_fixture.config(notification_format='cadf') resource_id = cadftaxonomy.UNKNOWN bad_domain_id = uuid.uuid4().hex group_ref = self.new_group_ref(domain_id=bad_domain_id) self.assertRaises(exception.DomainNotFound, self.identity_api.create_group, group_ref) self._assert_last_audit(resource_id, CREATED_OPERATION, 'group', cadftaxonomy.SECURITY_GROUP) self.assertTrue(len(self._audits) > 0) audit = self._audits[-1] payload = audit['payload'] self.assertEqual(cadftaxonomy.OUTCOME_FAILURE, payload['outcome'])

commit_message:
pin google-api-client to 0.9.4

google-api-client requires Ruby version ~> 2.0, so we need to pin to
0.9.4.

See https://github.com/google/google-api-ruby-client/issues/397

Change-Id: I97344431bc041b1482c2215e47a3ca022b8b9c89
(cherry picked from commit bca34a73c4307ecdd5a59acf9e4578680ab893ac)

commit_message:
Use "visibility" param in create_image() for V1

The create_image() methods for V1 and V2 accept different params
(is_public and visibility accordingly) to make an image public or private.
This patch makes the create_image() method for V1 accept the "visibility"
param like it does the corresponding method for V2. Thus, it will allow us
to pass only one "visibility" parameter to the Glance wrapper.

Change-Id: Ic72fe2256573e31a80c2f245540ef57a05ae6eb2

commit_message:
Adds missing attribute from get_cpus_info query

There is a new field added in cpu_info called MaxClockSpeed.
The field is not included in the query so its value will not
be retrieved with the query and it will be always None.

This patch adds the missing field in the query in order
to retrieve its value.

Closes-Bug: #1570345

Change-Id: Ie6d531ccd9fdb74c700dc6f52674d46838f5ee1a
(cherry picked from commit c478d43a7f9122af1bd15c39419242861f8c6137)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/os-win refs/changes/03/305903/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add a fork for Ironic vender driver

Add a fork when valuing DEVSTACK_GATE_IRONIC_DRIVER in setup_localrc
function, so that vender can enable its own driver, and write it
into IRONIC_ENABLED_DRIVERS of localrc, in a gate JOB.

Change-Id: Id3e7384a6dc76a5b6f4382b279c58496444c6da9
Closes-Bug: 1561296
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack-gate refs/changes/97/298097/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if [[ -z "${DEVSTACK_GATE_IRONIC_DRIVER%%agent_ssh*}" || -z "${DEVSTACK_GATE_IRONIC_DRIVER%%agent_ipmitool*}" ]]; then elif [[ -z "${DEVSTACK_GATE_IRONIC_DRIVER%%pxe_ssh*}" || -z "${DEVSTACK_GATE_IRONIC_DRIVER%%pxe_ipmitool*}" ]]; then else echo "IRONIC_ENABLED_DRIVERS=$IRONIC_ENABLED_DRIVERS" >>"$localrc_file"

commit_message:
Let BUILD_TIMEOUT in Ironic local.conf configurable

Before this fix:
BUILD_TIMEOUT is strict to 600 minutes
After this fix:
When BUILD_TIMEOUT has already been configured in environment
variable, will use it.

Change-Id: I1fb9b404b76864a8987f1e3baf209e0351c022b2
Closes-Bug: 1561855
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack-gate refs/changes/31/297531/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: export BUILD_TIMEOUT=${BUILD_TIMEOUT:-600} echo $BUILD_TIMEOUT >>"$localrc_file"

commit_message:
Fix filters in glance v1 wrapper

As in glance v2, filters are passed as a keyword argument. Unlike
glance v2, owner is a separate kwarg, not a generic filter. Our old
implementation accidentally worked because the only filter we ever
used was 'owner', but it would have broken as soon as we tried to pass
literally any other filter.

Change-Id: If190f6edaf36b64524c2b15fd9060a1dce0f98fc

commit_message:
Need to check for /etc/ssh in $TARGET_ROOT

As cleanup.d scripts are run outside of the
chroot, we need to check for the existence of
/etc/ssh in $TARGET_ROOT. Some base OS elements,
such as ubuntu-minimal, will not have ssh by
default, which will cause this to fail.

Change-Id: Icecd7ba85f940f13891f345979ca05988817a6c5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder refs/changes/77/306177/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
pin google-api-client to 0.9.4

google-api-client requires Ruby version ~> 2.0, so we need to pin to
0.9.4.

See https://github.com/google/google-api-ruby-client/issues/397

Change-Id: I97344431bc041b1482c2215e47a3ca022b8b9c89
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-openstack_spec_helper refs/changes/85/306085/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # google-api-client requires Ruby version ~> 2.0 spec.add_dependency 'google-api-client', ['0.9.4']

commit_message:
add missing num_engine_workers parameter

This option exists for heat::api but is missing for heat::engine.
This commit adds the missing num_engine_workers parameter.

Change-Id: I69565c13b732ef74531a516aac8a368597411856

commit_message:
Provide a release postmortem

This patch introduces a postmortem template for the
Neutron project, and brings a draft for the Mitaka
release that would need to be filled with the help
of the Mitaka contributors before Mitaka is released.

Change-Id: I30aac4e8adf57ab891f47cb7c4841d55c1422e00

commit_message:
[Rally] Load Neutron-LBaaS extension as devstack plugin

Devstack has removed LBaaS extension loaded as service,
so we have to load it as devstack plugin.

Change-Id: Ie7a2509f2393abf83f3c1197ecd4fd2461b21b39
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/09/305709/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: export NEUTRON_EXTENSIONS={neutron_extensions} if echo $NEUTRON_EXTENSIONS | grep :lbaas: >/dev/null; then DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'\n'"enable_plugin neutron-lbaas git://git.openstack.org/openstack/neutron-lbaas" fi neutron_extensions: ':lbaas:' services=key,mysql,rabbit,n-api,n-cond,n-cpu,n-crt,n-sch,g-api,g-reg,q-agt,q-dhcp,q-l3,q-meta,q-svc

commit_message:
Docs: switch to neutron-lbaas plugin

neutron-lbaas has been removed from devstack:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/195329/
Magnum needs to use their devstack plugin instead.

Change-Id: Id112c6859fd2b83d6f8864d6bdd9d7aaf3382f2e
Depends-On: Ia9cc4c40b41db1159ad6fd3c4ec1b17b502e0f5b

Add basic read-only function test for template validate

Add basic functional test for
"openstack orchestration template validate".

Change-Id: I8c0bf3a27a266eaa140f033ecf32d97d0f2f1ee7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-heatclient refs/changes/36/298936/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _orchestration_template_validate(self, templ_name, parms): heat_template_path = os.path.join( os.path.dirname(os.path.realpath(__file__)), '../../templates/%s' % templ_name) cmd = 'orchestration template validate --template %s'\ % heat_template_path for parm in parms: cmd += ' --parameter ' + parm ret = self.openstack(cmd) self.assertRegexpMatches(ret, r'Value:.*123') def test_orchestration_template_validate_yaml(self): self._orchestration_template_validate( 'heat_minimal.yaml', ['ClientName=ClientName', 'WaitSecs=123'] ) def test_orchestration_template_validate_hot(self): self._orchestration_template_validate( 'heat_minimal_hot.yaml', ['test_client_name=test_client_name', 'test_wait_secs=123'] )

commit_message:
Add project options to security group rule create

Add the --project and --project-domain options to the
'os security group rule create' command. These options
are for Network v2 only.

Change-Id: Ie3e136be076f0f2c22fbe7048d1d6eaebf5aa655
Partial-Bug: #1519512
Implements: blueprint neutron-client

commit_message:
Remove shocco docs and other cleanups

This is a fairly opinionated change to do some spring cleaning on the
documentation.

The current output of shocco as rendered at [1] is completely broken.
I can not see that it is worth us maintaining this.  Honestly, the
github page does a better job at showing the scripts with a bit of
formatting.  The "changes" page is similarly useless today.  cgit or
github show allow browsing of changes in the repo better.  Both are
removed along with support scripts.

When you currently hit the first page, it gives no clue as to what
DevStack actually is.  Add a paragraph explaining that, and link to
the cgit for easy source browsing.

stackrc.rst is not necessary; the stuff about database backends is
already discussed in configuration.rst; move the things about service
repos into a section of configuration.rst.

The discussion in openrc.rst is moved into the configuration.rst file.

localrc.conf.rst was just a paragraph pointing back to
configuration.rst; this is removed.

The variables described in exercise.rst are moved into a separate
section of configuration.rst

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/devstack/#scripts

Change-Id: Ie7f4b265368f1d10a8908d75e11d625b2cc39e7c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/15/303115/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: ============================== exerciserc - Exercise Settings ============================== ``exerciserc`` is used to configure settings for the exercise scripts. The values shown below are the default values. These can all be overridden by setting them in the ``localrc`` section. ACTIVE\_TIMEOUT Max time to wait while vm goes from build to active state :: ACTIVE_TIMEOUT==30 ASSOCIATE\_TIMEOUT Max time to wait for proper IP association and dis-association. :: ASSOCIATE_TIMEOUT=15 BOOT\_TIMEOUT Max time till the vm is bootable :: BOOT_TIMEOUT=30 RUNNING\_TIMEOUT Max time from run instance command until it is running :: RUNNING_TIMEOUT=$(($BOOT_TIMEOUT + $ACTIVE_TIMEOUT)) TERMINATE\_TIMEOUT Max time to wait for a vm to terminate :: TERMINATE_TIMEOUT=30

commit_message:
Dev doc update for moving abstract base classes out of core

As part of an effort to remove backend dependencies on higher level
classes, this patch updates the dev docs, defining a standard as to
where abstract base classes are located and named.

Partial-Bug: #1563101

Change-Id: I784e344f333ee616bda800f63af0b1c149a529f3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/17/302317/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: implementations. The abstract base classes are stored in the service's backends directory as ``base.py``. The classes are named after the keystone release in which* :mod:`keystone.assignment.core.backends.base.AssignmentDriverV8` * :mod:`keystone.assignment.core.backends.base.RoleDriverV8` * :mod:`keystone.catalog.core.backends.base.CatalogDriverV8` * :mod:`keystone.credential.core.backends.base.CredentialDriverV8` * :mod:`keystone.endpoint_policy.core.backends.base.EndpointPolicyDriverV8` * :mod:`keystone.federation.core.backends.base.FederationDriverV8` * :mod:`keystone.identity.core.backends.base.IdentityDriverV8` * :mod:`keystone.identity.core.backends.base.MappingDriverV8` * :mod:`keystone.oauth1.core.backends.base.Oauth1DriverV8` * :mod:`keystone.policy.core.backends.base.PolicyDriverV8` * :mod:`keystone.resource.core.backends.base.DomainConfigDriverV8` * :mod:`keystone.resource.core.backends.base.ResourceDriverV8` * :mod:`keystone.revoke.core.backends.base.RevokeDriverV8` * :mod:`keystone.token.core.backends.base.TokenDriverV8` * :mod:`keystone.trust.core.backends.base.TrustDriverV8`

commit_message:
Change Registry Label for Server to Instance

The registry has OS::Nova::Server registered with a label of Server.

This is not consistent with "instance" naming in horizon.
This impacts usage in the search panel.

Before:
http://pasteboard.co/8wghjVS.png

After:
http://pasteboard.co/8whGcA1.png

Change-Id: I41e24b56afea127fdc6fc4f66d9d3b119807b649
Closes-Bug: 1569493

commit_message:
Added script to create docker image

Once this patch is merged, I will modify gate
job to use this script to create image.

Change-Id: Ieed72e184d5eb8a5f57cb557df8dabce54d122cf
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/mistral refs/changes/71/305071/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/bin/bash -xe if [ -x "/usr/bin/apt-get" ]; then sudo -E apt-get update sudo -E apt-get install -y docker.io apparmor aufs-tools elif [ -x "/usr/bin/yum" ]; then sudo -E yum install -y docker-io gpg else echo "No supported package manager installed on system. Supported: apt, yum" exit 1 fi sudo docker build -t mistral-docker . sudo docker save mistral-docker | gzip > mistral-docker.tar.gz

Moved doc file and releasenote from service_status

Iaf10d8486ac8015ecf9f394dfbf074bfb863fb78 had a page of docs in
the wrong place, and was missing a releasenote for the feature.

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/designate refs/changes/39/306039/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. Copyright 2016 Hewlett Packard Enterprise Development Company LP All Rights Reserved. Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain a copy of the License at http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations under the License. Service Statuses ================ Overview ----------------------- The Service Status entries are used to track the health state of the services in the Designate system. Each service will report in it's health via RPC or using HTTP. Explanation ----------- ============ ============================================================== Attribute Description ============ ============================================================== service_name The name of the service, typically `central` or alike. hostname The hostname where the service is running. capabilities Service capabilities, used to tell a service of the same type apart. stats Statistics are optional per service metrics. status An enum describing the status of the service. UP for health and ok, DOWN for down (Ie the service hasn't reported in for a while) and WARNING if the service is having issues. ============ ==============================================================

commit_message:
Add multipart content-type test

Previously, we only looked at content-type to determine whether to treat
a response as a multipart document. With the parent commit, we also
require a 206 response code.

This adds a test that would fail with the old code.

Change-Id: I24d9e5974bf74cb45b1dc66a5f4716c85ef10b10
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/76/305976/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_GET_multipart_ciphertext(self): base64.b64encode(encrypt(md5hex(plaintext), key, FAKE_IV)), self.assertEqual(md5hex(plaintext), resp.headers['Etag']) #@mock.patch.object(decrypter, 'DECRYPT_CHUNK_SIZE', 4) def test_GET_multipart_content_type(self): # *just* having multipart content type shouldn't trigger the mime doc # code path key = fetch_crypto_keys()['object'] ctxt = Crypto({}).create_encryption_ctxt(key, FAKE_IV) plaintext = 'Cwm fjord veg balks nth pyx quiz' ciphertext = encrypt(plaintext, ctxt=ctxt) # register request with fake swift hdrs = { 'Etag': md5hex(ciphertext), 'content-type': 'multipart/byteranges;boundary=multipartboundary', 'content-length': len(ciphertext), 'X-Object-Sysmeta-Crypto-Etag': base64.b64encode(encrypt(md5hex(plaintext), key, FAKE_IV)), 'X-Object-Sysmeta-Crypto-Meta-Etag': get_crypto_meta_header(), 'X-Object-Sysmeta-Crypto-Meta': get_crypto_meta_header()} self.app.register('GET', '/v1/a/c/o', HTTPOk, body=ciphertext, headers=hdrs) # issue request env = {'REQUEST_METHOD': 'GET', CRYPTO_KEY_CALLBACK: fetch_crypto_keys} req = Request.blank('/v1/a/c/o', environ=env) resp = req.get_response(self.decrypter) self.assertEqual('200 OK', resp.status) self.assertEqual(md5hex(plaintext), resp.headers['Etag']) self.assertEqual(len(plaintext), int(resp.headers['Content-Length'])) self.assertEqual('multipart/byteranges;boundary=multipartboundary', resp.headers['Content-Type']) self.assertEqual(plaintext, resp.body)
deleted_lines: def test_GET_multipart(self): base64.b64encode(encrypt(md5hex(body), key, FAKE_IV)), self.assertEqual(md5hex(body), resp.headers['Etag'])

map correctly.

commit_message:
removed duplicate key

In review of this role it was discovered that we had a duplicate
key within a task. While this is acceptable in Ansible as it will
just use the last key found in a given task it is wrong and should
be removed. In later version of Ansible (2.1.0) a warning is printed
stating something similar to the following:

   [WARNING]: While constructing a mapping from xxx.yml, line xx,
     column xx, found a duplicate dict key (changed_when).  Using
     last defined value only. [WARNING]: While constructing a mapping
     from xxx.yml, line xx, column xx, found a duplicate dict key
     (changed_when).  Using last defined value only.

This chage cleans up the role by removing the duplication.

Change-Id: I216987614b7783b9250c5ddc62bfae433423e775
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit ff665afd1a177d65b8a4131a952f2af8b6aa61da)

subject: DVR: Clear stale SNAT namespace when agent restarts after router move
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-06 07:32:06.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/dc114739a552d00a35b4bc8a8d81b19ca75a33a6', 'message': 'DVR: Clear stale SNAT namespace when agent restarts after router move

When we move (manual move) a router from one dvr_snat node to
another dvr_snat node the snat_namespace will be removed by
the originating node by the agent and will be recreated in the
destination node by the destination agent.

But when the agent dies, the router_update message cannot reach
the agent and so the snat_namespace is untouched.

If the agent is restarted, the agent should be able to remove the
snat_namespace since it is no more hosted by the current agent.

This functionality was broken since the agent was not checking
for the existing namespace in the node and just comparing it with
the namespace in the namespace manager.

This patch provides a fix for cleaning up the stale snat namespace.

Change-Id: I6bc1646a81bafb024186865b3ce72af3d4c7228a
Closes-Bug: #1557909
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-04-08 00:15:03.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/agent/l3/test_agent.py', 'neutron/agent/l3/dvr_edge_router.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/5967f98e9ca0db4de05671a25c0d719aade1ec2d', 'message': 'DVR: Clear stale SNAT namespace when agent restarts after router move

When we move (manual move) a router from one dvr_snat node to
another dvr_snat node the snat_namespace should be removed by
the originating node by the agent and will be recreated in the
destination node by the destination agent.

But when the agent dies, the router_update message cannot reach
the agent and so the snat_namespace is untouched.

After the agent restarts, the agent should remove the
snat_namespace since it is no more hosted by the current agent.

Even though we do have the agent take care of stale namespaces on
a agent restart, this particular use case is not handled right.

This patch provides a fix for cleaning up just the snat namespace
on the dvr_snat node where the router binding was removed.

Change-Id: I6bc1646a81bafb024186865b3ce72af3d4c7228a
Closes-Bug: #1557909
'}]
commit_message:
DVR: Clear stale SNAT namespace when agent restarts after router move

When we move (manual move) a router from one dvr_snat node to
another dvr_snat node the snat_namespace should be removed by
the originating node by the agent and will be recreated in the
destination node by the destination agent.

But when the agent dies, the router_update message cannot reach
the agent and so the snat_namespace is untouched.

After the agent restarts, the agent should remove the
snat_namespace since it is no more hosted by the current agent.

Even though we do have the agent take care of stale namespaces on
a agent restart, this particular use case is not handled right.

This patch provides a fix for cleaning up just the snat namespace
on the dvr_snat node where the router binding was removed.

Change-Id: I6bc1646a81bafb024186865b3ce72af3d4c7228a
Closes-Bug: #1557909

commit_message:
Fix doc build if git is absent

When building packages if git is absent, then we should not set
html_last_updated_fmt. It can still be set via the -D switch
when building with sphinx-build.

Change-Id: Ibbfb81955e5e68553af551baeb17d4facd988e5c
Closes-Bug: #1552251

commit_message:
Set description field as required for nova-network

Project -> Access & Security Panel

Description field is required for creating a
new security group if nova-network is used.

subject: Make rsync ignore it's own temporary files
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-15 00:30:37.000000000', 'files': ['swift/obj/replicator.py', 'test/unit/obj/test_replicator.py', 'test/probe/test_object_handoff.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/f87a5487b5224f77261d82a1087d31820c29e8f8', 'message': "Make rsync ignore it's own temporary files

In situations where rsync may inadvertently be unable to cleanup it's
temporary files we shouldn't spread them around the cluster.

By asking our rsync subexec to --exclude patterns that match it's own
convention for temporary naming we'll only ever transfer real replicated
artifacts and never temporary artifacts which should always be ignored
until they are fully transfered.

Cleanup of stale rsync droppings should be performed by the auditor and
will be addressed in a separate change related to lp bug #1554005.

Closes-Bug: #1553995

Change-Id: Ibe598b339af024d05e4d89c34d696e972d8189ff
"}]
commit_message:
Make rsync ignore it's own temporary files

In situations where rsync may inadvertently be unable to cleanup it's
temporary files we shouldn't spread them around the cluster.

By asking our rsync subexec to --exclude patterns that match it's own
convention for temporary naming we'll only ever transfer real replicated
artifacts and never temporary artifacts which should always be ignored
until they are fully transfered.

Cleanup of stale rsync droppings should be performed by the auditor and
will be addressed in a separate change related to lp bug #1554005.

Closes-Bug: #1553995

Change-Id: Ibe598b339af024d05e4d89c34d696e972d8189ff

commit_message:
Add network options to security group rule create

Add the following network options to the "os security group rule"
command:
  (1) --ingress and --egress
  (2) --ethertype
These options enable egress and IPv6 security group rules for
Network v2.

Change-Id: Ie30b5e95f94e0c087b0ce81e518de72d2dda25ad
Partial-Bug: #1519512
Implements: blueprint neutron-client

commit_message:
Prefer assertEqual/assertIn over assertOutput/assertInOutput

functional.common.tests module defines:

 * assertOutput (similar to assertEqual)
 * assertInOutput (similar to assertIn)

in order to allow the usage of assertions in testcase classmethods but
there is no reason to use them in testcase instancemethods at least
because they raise Exception instances instead of AssertionError
instances.

Change-Id: I9ffcaf9c6e6a1ff5df6ea2d79be3fb4496db4b85

commit_message:
Gnocchi: Fix gate stable jobs

Since Mikita is released, Gnocchi stables 2.0 and 2.1 must be
gated on Mikita stable branches of other project.

Change-Id: I8f5da5dde5aa24757813b9c032f8ee561029e6c9

commit_message:
Add variable SWIFT_STORAGE_IPS

If the variable SWIFT_STORAGE_IPS contains a space-separated list of
IPs, we can use this to create consistent rings across all proxy and
storage nodes.

Change-Id: If9307196dc7e74e4a842c95503958ae2d7f7acc7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/68/304468/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # If this is a multinode setup, we will add all subnodes as storage # nodes. The ring will be created on each node, and because the order of # nodes is identical we can use a seed for rebalancing, making it # possible to get a ring on each node that uses the same partition # assignment. if [ -f /etc/swift/storage_nodes ]; then local sub_nodes local node_number node_number=1 storage_nodes=$(cat /etc/swift/storage_nodes) for node in $storage_nodes; do swift-ring-builder object.builder add z${node_number}-${node}:$(( OBJECT_PORT_BASE + 10 * (node_number - 1) ))/sdb1 1 swift-ring-builder container.builder add z${node_number}-${node}:$(( CONTAINER_PORT_BASE + 10 * (node_number - 1) ))/sdb1 1 swift-ring-builder account.builder add z${node_number}-${node}:$(( ACCOUNT_PORT_BASE + 10 * (node_number - 1) ))/sdb1 1 let "node_number=node_number+1" done else for node_number in ${SWIFT_REPLICAS_SEQ}; do swift-ring-builder object.builder add z${node_number}-${SWIFT_SERVICE_LOCAL_HOST}:$(( OBJECT_PORT_BASE + 10 * (node_number - 1) ))/sdb1 1 swift-ring-builder container.builder add z${node_number}-${SWIFT_SERVICE_LOCAL_HOST}:$(( CONTAINER_PORT_BASE + 10 * (node_number - 1) ))/sdb1 1 swift-ring-builder account.builder add z${node_number}-${SWIFT_SERVICE_LOCAL_HOST}:$(( ACCOUNT_PORT_BASE + 10 * (node_number - 1) ))/sdb1 1 done fi # We use a seed for rebalancing. Doing this allows us to create # identical rings on multiple nodes if the above input is the same swift-ring-builder object.builder rebalance 42 swift-ring-builder container.builder rebalance 42 swift-ring-builder account.builder rebalance 42
deleted_lines: for node_number in ${SWIFT_REPLICAS_SEQ}; do swift-ring-builder object.builder add z${node_number}-${SWIFT_SERVICE_LOCAL_HOST}:$(( OBJECT_PORT_BASE + 10 * (node_number - 1) ))/sdb1 1 swift-ring-builder container.builder add z${node_number}-${SWIFT_SERVICE_LOCAL_HOST}:$(( CONTAINER_PORT_BASE + 10 * (node_number - 1) ))/sdb1 1 swift-ring-builder account.builder add z${node_number}-${SWIFT_SERVICE_LOCAL_HOST}:$(( ACCOUNT_PORT_BASE + 10 * (node_number - 1) ))/sdb1 1 done swift-ring-builder object.builder rebalance swift-ring-builder container.builder rebalance swift-ring-builder account.builder rebalance

commit_message:
Optionally allow autocomplete in Horizon

Horizon disables password autocompletion by default. This causes
problems for users who use password managers and want to store
their Horizon credentials. This patch adds a variable that allows
a deployer to override this default.

Release notes are included.

Change-Id: I8eaa5a1773e6f182c436b312f2733a21505a867c
Closes-Bug: 1570505
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_horizon refs/changes/92/305992/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: {% if horizon_enable_password_autocomplete | bool %} HORIZON_CONFIG["password_autocomplete"] = "on" {% else %} HORIZON_CONFIG["password_autocomplete"] = "off" {% endif %}

commit_message:
Use oslo module for messaging (rabbit) configuration

Additonal changes:

  * switch messaging related parameters to $::os_service_default
    as they are used in oslo::messaging_rabbit define
  * update unit tests
  * update docs for notify::rabbitmq class
  * drop deprecated rabbit_durable_queues parameter
  * fix notification parameters according to mitaka config file

Change-Id: Ib20c13f136a299c958d9ac064e8ad93ceb0ebd40

true, :rabbit_password => 'pass' } end it { is_expected.to contain_glance_api_config('oslo_messaging_rabbit/amqp_durable_queues').with_value('true') } end

commit_message:
Verify pci_passthrough_whitelist fields

It's currently possible to supply an empty string for devname,
also it's currently possible to have an entry that lacks a
devname, address, and both product and vendor ids.

Added checks for invalid entries, mainly devname containing
an empty string, only specifying physical_address, and only providing
one of the two ids.

Added tests for these invalid entries.

Added exception/message for these invalid entries.

Change-Id: I8133393febab051eca9a3b61835ad8ce81cb3087
Closes-Bug: #1466451

commit_message:
Fix API validation of DPDK properties on the node's interfaces

Now validator does not recalculate DPDK availability but takes
its value from DB.
Also, validator now works properly when 'dpdk' section does not
present in API request.

Change-Id: Ief7f496c0de3ac3c1c09003f72d3c4056a57f749
Partial-Bug: #1564102

subject: Fix doc build if git is absent
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-13 07:48:43.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/conf.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/sahara/commit/e36d2c6c5608e8674cc48a5ac69a95ec69572f95', 'message': 'Fix doc build if git is absent

When building packages if git is absent, then we should not set
html_last_updated_fmt. It can still be set via the -D switch
when building with sphinx-build.

Change-Id: Idfe2d99f8dae191fa6c7ab897a1d2b4f9491b2fa
Closes-Bug: #1552251
'}]
commit_message:
Fix doc build if git is absent

When building packages if git is absent, then we should not set
html_last_updated_fmt. It can still be set via the -D switch
when building with sphinx-build.

Change-Id: Idfe2d99f8dae191fa6c7ab897a1d2b4f9491b2fa
Closes-Bug: #1552251

commit_message:
fernet: make it working out of the box

1) run the Exec with keystone user
When creating fernet files, if we don't run keystone-manage with
keystone user, Puppet will run it as root, and
/var/log/keystone/keystone.log will have wrong permissions, and db_sync
will fail later.
We need to ensure that exec is run with the right user.

2) deploy keys in /var/lib/keystone/fernet-keys instead of
/etc/keystone/fernet-keys.
Using /etc/keystone/fernet-keys does not work because Keystone has
permissions issues when creating the fernet keys. This change is not
backward compatible but since it did not work before, we think this is
acceptable. A release note explains it.

Closes-Bug: #1551864
Change-Id: I74fc7b3295207d24269dff25f4a18ff557b64910

commit_message:
repos/centos: deploy Ceph with SIG and get rid of EPEL

This patch will change the way we deployed Ceph on CentOS nodes.

* Use CentOS SIG by default
https://wiki.centos.org/SpecialInterestGroup/Storage/

* Stop deploying EPEL, which is conflicting with RDO packaging.

All our CI needs should be in RDO and SIG. Let's stop deploying EPEL at
all.

Change-Id: I8d435a77c41c38354b20a40ab30dbc595cb6412c
(cherry picked from commit cb015ed05b2105daa53262297dd3da05786f4f9e)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-openstack-integration refs/changes/47/305847/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: manage_rdo => false, manage_epel => false, repo_hash => { # On CentOS, deploy Ceph using SIG repository and get rid of EPEL. # https://wiki.centos.org/SpecialInterestGroup/Storage/ if $::operatingsystem == 'CentOS' { $enable_sig = true $enable_epel = false } else { $enable_sig = false $enable_epel = true } class { '::ceph::repo': enable_sig => $enable_sig, enable_epel => $enable_epel, }
deleted_lines: # yum-plugin-priorities is already managed by ::ceph::repo manage_priorities => false, manage_rdo => false, manage_epel => false, repo_hash => { class { '::ceph::repo': }

commit_message:
Add canvas timeline implementation

This adds a new timeline renderer using a plain canvas element,
replacing the d3 and svg-based renderer. This new implementation
greatly improves timeline performance, especially on less powerful
graphics cards, and more than doubles the resulting framerate while
panning the view by aggressively caching previously rendered chart
regions. Additionally, worst-case memory usage is greatly reduced
during heavier periods of user interaction.

This new implementation also removes several previous limitations.
Due to cached rendering a nearly unlimited number of objects can be
shown at any time with no performance impact, so small objects never
need to be hidden from view at any zoom level. Also, view transitions
can now be smoothly animated, and reach a stable framerate even on
older mobile devices.

Change-Id: Ib883e056270eff688b4b4a0c340eaea20cceb181

commit_message:
Move project-configs to gate hook

Fix gate broken, we keep project configs in gate_hook.sh so we don't
need to subumit requests to project-config and wait for their
approval

Change-Id: Ia9cc4c40b41db1159ad6fd3c4ec1b17b502e0f5b

commit_message:
Set db connection retry to infinity

Make sure that all the sevices will attempt to
connect to the database an infinite about of times.
If the database ever disappears for some reason we
want the services to try and reconnect more than just
10 times.

Closes-bug: #1505636
Change-Id: I77abbf72ce5bfd68faa451bb9a72bd2544963f4b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/34/302434/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

Add legend to project status list

the meaning of the colors with this.

commit_message:
Drop root for swift

Updates to ensure commands run in the swift containers
are done as the 'swift' user rather than root.

Change-Id: I8c5a12e24b9940200241dbe09d6bde8f1cc1cf05
Closes-Bug: #1553895
Co-Authored-By: Serguei Bezverkhi <sbezverk@cisco.com>

commit_message:
Fix ovs creation of the port

This patch fix the mac address of the port to the right value.
It also creates the port atomically (with the various details),
avoiding it to be misinterpreted by ovs-agent.

Change-Id: I16f89a30ac3b47eeaa5edddd37712934729fdf93
Closes-Bug: 1569412
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kuryr refs/changes/90/305790/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: sudo ovs-vsctl -- --may-exist add-port $INT_BRIDGE $2 -- \ set interface $2 external_ids:attached-mac=$4 \ external_ids:iface-status=active external_ids:owner=kury
deleted_lines: mac=`ip link show dev $2 | tail -1 | awk '{print $2}'` sudo ovs-vsctl add-port $INT_BRIDGE $2 sudo ovs-vsctl set interface $2 external_ids:attached-mac=$mac \ external_ids:iface-status=active external_ids:owner=kuryr

commit_message:
Fix API validation of DPDK properties on the node's interfaces

Now validator does not validate DPDK availability. It's always
calculated on the fly.
Also, validator now works properly when 'dpdk' section does not
present in API request.

Change-Id: Ibaf7919ac0068cdb6a1be93b74ebc0c4886ac934
Partial-Bug: #1564102

added_lines: def create_cluster_and_node_with_dpdk_support(self, segment_type, drivers_mock): return node def check_update_dpdk_availability(self, node, dpdk_available): return resp.json_body def check_put_request_passes_without_dpdk_section(self, node, nics): # remove 'dpdk' section from all interfaces for nic in nics: nic['interface_properties'].pop('dpdk', None) resp = self.app.put( reverse("NodeNICsHandler", kwargs={"node_id": node['id']}), jsonutils.dumps(nics), headers=self.default_headers) self.assertEqual(resp.status_code, 200) node = self.create_cluster_and_node_with_dpdk_support( consts.NEUTRON_SEGMENT_TYPES.tun, drivers_mock) nics = self.check_update_dpdk_availability(node, False) self.check_put_request_passes_without_dpdk_section(node, nics) node = self.create_cluster_and_node_with_dpdk_support( consts.NEUTRON_SEGMENT_TYPES.vlan, drivers_mock) nics = self.check_update_dpdk_availability(node, True) self.check_put_request_passes_without_dpdk_section(node, nics)
deleted_lines: def check_update_dpdk_availability(self, segment_type, drivers_mock, dpdk_available): self.check_update_dpdk_availability(consts.NEUTRON_SEGMENT_TYPES.tun, drivers_mock, False) self.check_update_dpdk_availability(consts.NEUTRON_SEGMENT_TYPES.vlan, drivers_mock, True)

commit_message:
Fix heat trustee configuration

Based on: I6305be3c693993de4d16d82fd6de936e92c437c5
Removing project_domain_id and project_name since they cannot be
specified in this section or keystone will throw a "cannot be scoped
to multiple targets error" and auth_uri is unused by the
keystoneclient password auth plugins.

Backport of I6b4eb2301690038b717a0b51490036dd30e76edd

Change-Id: I149226977398506ac4ae56589fc7ccc92f6d9384
Closes-Bug: 1565550

commit_message:
Add logic check for xenial APT mirrors

Because reprepro will not mirror repositories with 0 packages,
xenial-backports, xenial-updates, xenial-security are missing from
AFS.  Until we have them populated, we'll only configure APT to use
the xenial mirror.

Change-Id: Id4d788097ae4e1a5d0f13cb84a46fbb9ac9a839e
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/84/305884/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE(pabelanger): Only setup mirrors for ubuntu-trusty, this logic check can # be removed once our AFS mirrors for ubuntu xenial contain all the repositories # listed below. if [ "$LSBDISTID" == "Ubuntu" ] && [ "$LSBDISTCODENAME" == "trusty" ] ; then

commit_message:
deploy glance using puppet-tripleo manifests

This is a first iteration of deploying Glance API & Registry by using
Puppet code present in puppet-tripleo instead of TripleO Heat Templates.

Change-Id: I317775bd83f94f88f300bc52c260f4c05a651035
Depends-On: Ifc388f7058ccfff2818f531bcbc00c7179874bbc

commit_message:
seperate formating option for ipv4 and ipv6 in desingate sink service

Change-Id: Ic7962d475a93f4986c8eaa041c616d33f4788ac2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/designate-specs refs/changes/99/278999/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ============================= The title of your blueprint ============================= https://blueprints.launchpad.net/designate/+spec/different-format-for-ipv4-and-ipv6 Different FQDN formats for IPv4 and IPv6 ips. Right now we have a single format to define FQDN for records created through designate sink. Problem description =================== At present there is only one format we can define for both IPv4 and IPv6 ips. If a user want to have different naming convention for records created through Sink service we dont have a way to do that since there is only one option in designate.conf where we defing the FQDN format. Proposed change =============== In designate.conf we should give an option under the Sink configuration where we can define two different formats for IPv4 and IPv6. Similarly in we need to make appropriate changes in sink code under designate/notification_handler/ for base.py, nova.py and neutron.py SINK Changes ------------ Base.py, nova.py and neutron.py needs to be changed to get the format type from designate.conf. The new formats that we need to get are formatv4 and formatv6 which will now be implemented in designate.conf. API Changes ----------- None Central Changes --------------- None Storage Changes --------------- None Other Changes ------------- None Alternatives ------------ This is an optional section, where it does apply we'd just like a demonstration that some thought has been put into why the proposed approach is the best one. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: Kumar Acharya<ma501v> Milestones ---------- Target Milestone for completion: Mitaka-3 Work Items ---------- Define the format for IPV4 and IPv6 FQDN and Implement it in designate.conf Code changes required in designate Dependencies ============ formatv4 and formatv6 should be implemented in designate.conf as new format types

Modify output of "designate help domain-list"

This patch modifies the designate python client
so that "designate help domain-list" show help
message for "--all-tenants" parameter.

Closes-Bug: #1466695

Change-Id: I1b7908dd547ac898118785f491163e51c826982d

commit_message:
Add designate-sink support to DevStack plugin

Change-Id: I449a2f5e0a5cf86429d13292f7a9f15e325f115c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/designate refs/changes/78/170678/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Designate Sink options DESIGNATE_SINK_HANDLERS=${DESIGNATE_SINK_HANDLERS:-nova_fixed,neutron_floatingip} DESIGNATE_SINK_DOMAIN_ID=${DESIGNATE_SINK_DOMAIN_ID:-a74fcfee-9c8d-40df-b98d-ad18d2c37489} DESIGNATE_SINK_DOMAIN_NAME=${DESIGNATE_SINK_DOMAIN_NAME:-sink.example.com.} # Designate Sink Nova/Neutron Integration if is_service_enabled designate-sink; then iniset $DESIGNATE_CONF service:sink enabled_notification_handlers "$DESIGNATE_SINK_HANDLERS" iniset $DESIGNATE_CONF handler:nova_fixed notification-topics "dnsnotifications" iniset $DESIGNATE_CONF handler:nova_fixed domain-id "$DESIGNATE_SINK_DOMAIN_ID" iniset $DESIGNATE_CONF handler:neutron_floatingip notification-topics "dnsnotifications" iniset $DESIGNATE_CONF handler:neutron_floatingip domain-id "$DESIGNATE_SINK_DOMAIN_ID" if is_service_enabled nova; then iniset $NOVA_CONF DEFAULT notification_driver "messaging" if ini_has_option $NOVA_CONF DEFAULT notification_topics; then iniset $NOVA_CONF DEFAULT notification_topics "$(iniget $NOVA_CONF DEFAULT notification_topics),dnsnotifications" else iniset $NOVA_CONF DEFAULT notification_topics "dnsnotifications" fi fi if is_service_enabled neutron; then iniset $NEUTRON_CONF DEFAULT notification_driver "messaging" if ini_has_option $NEUTRON_CONF DEFAULT notification_topics; then iniset $NEUTRON_CONF DEFAULT notification_topics "$(iniget $NEUTRON_CONF DEFAULT notification_topics),dnsnotifications" else iniset $NEUTRON_CONF DEFAULT notification_topics "dnsnotifications" fi fi fi # create_designate_domains - Create any domains required for DevStack function create_designate_domains { if is_service_enabled designate-sink; then # Create the domain used by Designate Sink. We're relying on a bug here, where # users are able to "choose" their own Domain ID. This should be fixed, and an # alternative worked out for this. curl -H "X-Auth-Token: $SERVICE_TOKEN" -H "Content-Type: application/json" \ -d "{\"id\": \"$DESIGNATE_SINK_DOMAIN_ID\", \"name\": \"$DESIGNATE_SINK_DOMAIN_NAME\", \"email\": \"admin@devstack.org\"}" \ $DESIGNATE_SERVICE_PROTOCOL://$DESIGNATE_SERVICE_HOST:$DESIGNATE_SERVICE_PORT/v1/domains fi }

Pool NS update test should validate zones are updated

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/designate refs/changes/32/228832/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Ensure we have a zone on the pool zone = self.create_domain(pool_id=pool.id) # Ensure the Zone has the new NS Records url = '/zones/%s/recordsets' % zone['id'] params = {'type': 'NS'} response = self.client.get(url, params) # Ensure we only matched one RecordSet self.assertEqual(1, len(response.json['recordsets'])) records = response.json['recordsets'][0]['records'] # Ensure the RecordSet has exactly 2 records self.assertEqual(2, len(records)) # Ensure the new values are present self.assertEqual( ['new-ns1.example.org.', 'new-ns2.example.org.'], records)

commit_message:
Reduce mDNS logging during retries

During poll_for_serial_number, we log too much info.
Reduce this down to debug level, and log a warning
only upon failure to retrieve the expected serial.

Change-Id: I58557f0cbb4de6987653324ee7bda92f00c35a97

commit_message:
Use multiple UDP response sockets for DNS

Eventlet would complain loudly about multiple readers/writers
to the UDP DNS socket, use a separate UDP socket for responses
to avoid this scenario.

Change-Id: I9e3d0474e6124617925859c0d03e831ca75c79ad
Closes-Bug: 1471789

commit_message:
Security fuzz tests for RecordSets

These tests will attempt various CRUD operations, and attempt to inject
different kinds of "fuzz strings" into the requests to try to get
unexpected results. Currently, most API methods will be tested for the
following issues:

- Remote code execution (RCE)
- SQL injection (SQLi)
- Second-order cross-site scripting (XSS)
- DoS/500 errors via various junk payloads (conversion errors, etc.)

Depends-On: I3f8e3f65061f18f3242d34a7e529b2f652bd573e
Depends-On: I2e404a0c66d54b64915d196910ce87f4886d118a
Change-Id: I7ca0359529cfa77a689aa134746e9bd4439e898a

commit_message:
Improve logging in designate.backend

We should delegate (when possible) formatting to the logger in order to
perform formatting only when needed, by using:

LOG.<level>(message, data)

instead of:

LOG.<level>(message % data)

and

 try:
   ...
 except ...:
   LOG.exception("lorem ipsum")

instead of:

 try:
   ...
 except ... as e:
   LOG.error("lorem ipsum: %s:", e)

This change also remove oslo.log module import but unused.

Change-Id: Icf8879d0cd4db63ef4656d4a1ceba4d3c8bf29d7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/designate refs/changes/41/244541/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Improve logging in designate.central

We should delegate (when possible) formatting to the logger in order to
perform formatting only when needed, by using:

LOG.<level>(message, data)

instead of:

LOG.<level>(message % data)

Change-Id: Ie0f3a0da21edb12a29bb7dbf44908b1c3c591309

subject: Changes volume_services default value for mitaka
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-14 17:38:50.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/config.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/d383a90f917aca1304d283209aed9d134ea80fb4', 'message': 'Changes volume_services default value for mitaka

When requesting the list of services by hostname from cinder
in previos releases like kilo and liberty the list would filter
out those hosts that had the format host@backend, but in mitaka
those hosts are included in the list. So in order for the
test_get_service_by_host_name to work fine for mitaka, the
volume_services config value should be set to True. Currently it
is set to False to match liberty release.

This change sets the volume_services default value to True so the
test works properly in the mitaka release.

It is related to change Id72863c4a4fa77aff42a7e69e7e8be8080166ae5

Closes-Bug: #1568959

Change-Id: I8ec19ff19b831df75f4602d7a544792d253e10f2
'}]
commit_message:
Changes volume_services default value for mitaka

When requesting the list of services by hostname from cinder
in previos releases like kilo and liberty the list would filter
out those hosts that had the format host@backend, but in mitaka
those hosts are included in the list. So in order for the
test_get_service_by_host_name to work fine for mitaka, the
volume_services config value should be set to True. Currently it
is set to False to match liberty release.

This change sets the volume_services default value to True so the
test works properly in the mitaka release.

It is related to change Id72863c4a4fa77aff42a7e69e7e8be8080166ae5

Closes-Bug: #1568959

Change-Id: I8ec19ff19b831df75f4602d7a544792d253e10f2

commit_message:
Fixed connection limit for HA Proxy

Set maxconn in global section instead of frontend.
Because frontend's maxconn is not applied.

Change-Id: Iadef5f8fc1436255287f67474726731d8527d399
Closes-bug: #1544861
Signed-off-by: Takashi Okamoto <okamoto_takashi_p3@lab.ntt.co.jp>

commit_message:
Improve logging in designate.api

We should delegate (when possible) formatting to the logger in order to
perform formatting only when needed, by using:

 LOG.<level>(message, data)

instead of:

 LOG.<level>(message % data)

This change also remove oslo_log module import but unused.

Change-Id: I13fa5a1d6eab671ea66cc4d3e082fa66ef7aaf41
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/designate refs/changes/37/244537/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: from oslo_log import log as loggingLOG = logging.getLogger(__name__)

commit_message:
Support volume migration in Ceph driver

If volume migration is supported in Ceph driver, we could offload
volume migration from cinder-volume host to ceph cluster. It could make
full use of ceph's inherent data copy feature and the hardware capacity
of ceph storage cluster to expedite the volume data copy speed, and
reduce the IO load on cinder-volume host.

blueprint ceph-volume-migrate

Change-Id: I05fa577f640594025f8f68fe96d9f5118f987aab
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder-specs refs/changes/50/296150/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ============================================== Support volume migration in Ceph driver ============================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/cinder/+spec/ceph-volume-migrate Currently cinder supports volume migration with backend assistance. Some backends like IPSANs support migrating volume in backend level, but Ceph not. Though Ceph volume migration has already been supported through cinder generic migration process in Liberty, the migration efficiency is not so good. It is necessary to support volume migration in the Ceph driver to improve the efficiency of migration. Problem description =================== Suppose there are two cinder volume backends which are in the same Ceph storage cluster. Now volume migration between two Ceph volume backends is implemented by generic migration logic. Migration operation can proceed with file operations on handles returned from the os-brick connectors, but the migration efficiency is limited on file I/O speed. If we offload migration operation from cinder-volume host to Ceph storage cluster, we would get the following benefits: * Improve the volume migration efficiency between two Ceph storage pools, especially when the volume's capacity and data size is big. * Reduce the IO pressure on cinder-volume host when doing the volume migration. Use Cases ========= There are three cases for volume migration. The scope of this spec is for the available volumes only and targets to resolve the issues within the following migration case 1: Within the scope of this spec 1) Available volume migration between two pools from the same Ceph cluster. Out of the scope of the spec 2) Available volume migration between Ceph and other vendor driver. 3) In-use(attached) volume migration using Cinder generic migration. Proposed change =============== Solution A: use rbd.Image.copy(dest_ioctx, dest_name) function to migrate volume from one pool to another pool. To offload migration operation from cinder-volume host to ceph cluster, we need to do the following changes in migrate_volume routine in RBD driver. * Check whether source volume backend and destination volume backend are in the same ceph storage cluster or not. * If not, return (False, None). * If yes, use rbd.Image.copy(dest_ioctx, dest_name) function to copy volume from one pool to another pool. * Delete the old volume. Alternatives ------------ Solution B: use ceph's functions of clone image and flatten clone image to migrate volume from one pool to another pool. Solution B contains the following steps: * Create source volume snapshot snap_a and protect the snapshot snap_a. * Clone a child image image_a of snap_a to the destination pool. * Flatten the child image image_a, thus snap_a has not been depended on. * Unprotect the snapshot snap_a and delete it. Using a volume which's capacity and data size is 12GB to show the time-consuming comparison between solution A and solution B. * [Solution-A]Copy volumes1/volume-777617f2-e286-44b8-baff-d1e8b792cc52 from "volumes1" pool to "volumes2" pool. root@2C5_19_CG1# time rbd cp volumes1/volume-777617f2-e286-44b8-baff-d1e8b792cc52 volumes2/test1 Image copy: 100% complete...done. real 2m3.513s user 0m9.983s sys 0m25.213s * [Solution-B-step-1]Create a snapshot of volume 777617f2-e286-44b8-baff-d1e8b792cc52 and protect it. root@2C5_19_CG1# time rbd snap create --pool volumes1 --image volume-777617f2-e286-44b8-baff-d1e8b792cc52 --snap snap_test real 0m0.465s user 0m0.050s sys 0m0.016s root@2C5_19_CG1# time rbd snap protect volumes1/volume-777617f2-e286-44b8-baff-d1e8b792cc52@snap_test real 0m0.128s user 0m0.057s sys 0m0.006s * [Solution-B-step-2]Do clone operation on volumes1/volume-777617f2-e286-44b8-baff-d1e8b792cc52@snap_test. root@2C5_19_CG1# time rbd clone volumes1/volume-777617f2-e286-44b8-baff-d1e8b792cc52@snap_test volumes2/snap_test_clone real 0m0.336s user 0m0.058s sys 0m0.012s * [Solution-B-step-3]Flatten the clone image volumes2/snap_test_clone. root@2C5_19_CG1# time rbd flatten volumes2/snap_test_clone Image flatten: 100% complete...done. real 1m58.469s user 0m4.513s sys 0m17.181s * [Solution-B-step-4]Unprotect the snap volumes1/volume-777617f2-e286-44b8-baff-d1e8b792cc52@snap_test and delete it. root@2C5_19_CG1# time rbd snap unprotect volumes1/volume-777617f2-e286-44b8-baff-d1e8b792cc52@snap_test real 0m0.150s user 0m0.058s sys 0m0.013s root@2C5_19_CG1# time rbd snap rm volumes1/volume-777617f2-e286-44b8-baff-d1e8b792cc52@snap_test real 0m0.418s user 0m0.054s sys 0m0.011s By the above test results of solution A and solution B, solution A needs (real:2m3.513s, user:0m9.983s, sys:0m25.213s) to finish the volume copy operation and solution B needs (real:1m59.966s, user:0m4.790s, sys:0m17.239s) to do that. The time-consuming for the both two solutions are not much difference, but solution A is more simpler than solution B. So we intend to use solution A to offload volume migration from cinder-volume host to ceph cluster. Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- None Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: chen-xueying1<chen.xueying1@zte.com.cn> Other contributors: ji-xuepeng<ji.xuepeng@zte.com.cn> Work Items ---------- * Implement code that mentioned in "Proposed change". Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= Unit tests will be added. Volume migration test case will be added. Both unit and Tempest tests need to be created to cover the code change that mentioned in "Proposed change" and ensure that volume migration feature works well while introducing the feature of RBD volume migration. Documentation Impact ==================== None References ========== None

commit_message:
Support to add certificate in ironic-agent

This commits provides support to add certificate while
building the image using ironic-agent element. The
certificate can be CA certificate or self-signed certificate.

The certificate is set to the environment variable
'DIB_IPA_CERT' which in turn is used by the ironic-agent
element while building the image.

Change-Id: I648f7934d4787dcc3030885cfca771b642a9595e

commit_message:
Reworked ApplyChanges for LCM

The following legacy tasks were reworked to use ClusterTransaction:
 - OpenstackConfigTaskManager
 - SpawnVMsTaskManager

Change-Id: I4a6f5f37161e4290050ec4926cf029cd7af566e4
(cherry picked from commit I4a6f5f37161e4290050ec4926cf029cd7af566e4)
Closes-Bug: 1565885
Closes-Bug: 1561994
Closes-Bug: 1565760

commit_message:
Adapt tests for new re-deployment logic

Deployment logic was changed in [1] to start deployment
tasks even if there are no changes to be deployed.

This patch updates functional tests accordingly.

1. I4a6f5f37161e4290050ec4926cf029cd7af566e4

Change-Id: Id8813314f5f8f47a100cbf0975ab60a488164839

commit_message:
zuul/layout: run intergation jobs on puppet-mistral

Mistral is now deployed in scenario002 of Puppet OpenStack
Integration testing, and we run Tempest.
This patch runs the jobs for puppet-mistral.

Depends-On: Ia43427cc207ee5b7b95e9610f06a568992fb58cd
Change-Id: Ibc2829d55624d0b2f305d867e129bc1a90a46302

commit_message:
Use InAnyOrder for role creation mocks

The user/roles can be created in any order due to
python random seed ordering dictionaries, so the
mocks should be in random order

Change-Id: I23a9380fb65ac634831beb496af388381d0230d4
Partial-Bug: #1348818

commit_message:
206 status check for multipart mime doc

Add a 206 status check along with content-type check to ensure we are
decrypting multipart mime doc- avoids situation when user may want to
store multipart mime doc

Change-Id: Ic1ef6b362b8a3821af92bb6e66f111d438ebc10d

commit_message:
Iptables firewall prevent IP spoofed DHCP requests

The DHCP rules in the fixed iptables firewall rules were too permissive.
They permitted any UDP traffic with a source port of 68 and destination
port of 67. Care must be taken since these rules return before the IP
spoofing prevention rules. This patch splits the fixed DHCP rules into
two, one for the discovery and request messages which take place before
the instance has bound an IP address and a second to permit DHCP
renewals.

Conflicts:
	neutron/agent/linux/iptables_firewall.py
	neutron/tests/functional/agent/test_firewall.py
	neutron/tests/unit/agent/linux/test_iptables_firewall.py
	neutron/tests/unit/agent/test_securitygroups_rpc.py

Partial-Bug: #1558658
(cherry picked from commit 6a93ee8ac1a901c255e3475a24f1afc11d8bf80f)

commit_message:
Iptables firewall prevent IP spoofed DHCP requests

The DHCP rules in the fixed iptables firewall rules were too permissive.
They permitted any UDP traffic with a source port of 68 and destination
port of 67. Care must be taken since these rules return before the IP
spoofing prevention rules. This patch splits the fixed DHCP rules into
two, one for the discovery and request messages which take place before
the instance has bound an IP address and a second to permit DHCP
renewals.

Change-Id: Ibc2b0fa80baf2ea8b01fa568cd1fe7a7e092e7a5
Partial-Bug: #1558658
(cherry picked from commit 6a93ee8ac1a901c255e3475a24f1afc11d8bf80f)
