commit_message:
Move DHCP updates onto worker thread, coalesce port updates

Change-Id: Id3a3dd96ed99242e8b7d62ea9e16d1a666a73885
Related-Bug: #1453350
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/58/220758/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Manages a DHCP driver (such as the dnsmasq wrapper). Architecture: - Receives RPC messages for networks, subnet and port CRUD operations. - To avoid blocking the RPC queue while handling the messages, queues all updates to a worker thread. - The worker thread processes messages in turn, coalescing port updates into single calls to the driver's reload_allocations method. """Cache of the current state of the networks, owned by the worker thread.""" self.queue = eventlet.queue.Queue() """Queue used to send messages to our worker thread.""" self.dirty_networks = set() """ Set of networks that need to be refreshed via a call to the driver's reload_allocations method. """ """ Starts the worker thread, which owns the driver and does our periodic resyncs. """ eventlet.spawn(self._loop) def _loop(self): """ Worker loop, owns the driver and cache. """ while True: if self.needs_resync_reasons: # be careful to avoid a race with additions to list # from other threads reasons = self.needs_resync_reasons self.needs_resync_reasons = collections.defaultdict(list) for net, r in reasons.items(): if not net: net = "*" LOG.debug("resync (%(network)s): %(reason)s", {"reason": r, "network": net}) self.sync_state(reasons.keys()) try: # Wait for messages. Wake up at least every resync interval # to check for any need to resync. batch = [self.queue.get(timeout=self.conf.resync_interval)] except eventlet.queue.Empty: continue else: # Opportunistically grab as many messages as we can from the # queue. This allows us to coalesce multiple port # update/delete messages below. Since we don't yield here, # we also can't build up an unlimited batch. while not self.queue.empty(): batch.append(self.queue.get()) while batch: msg_hndlr, params = batch.pop(0) if (self.dirty_networks and (msg_hndlr not in (self._handle_port_delete, self._handle_port_update))): # This isn't a message that we can coalesce, process # any dirty networks now before we handle the message # itself. self._reload_dirty_networks() msg_hndlr(**params) if self.dirty_networks: self._reload_dirty_networks() @utils.synchronized('dhcp-agent') def _reload_dirty_networks(self): """ Calls reload_allocations for any networks marked as dirty. Clears the dirty_networks set. """ for network_id in self.dirty_networks: network = self.cache.get_network_by_id(network_id) self.call_driver('reload_allocations', network) self.dirty_networks.clear() def network_create_end(self, context, payload): """ Handle the network.create.end notification event. Parses the message and then queues the operation. """ LOG.info("Network created: %s", network_id) self.queue.put((self._handle_network_create, {"network_id": network_id})) def _handle_network_create(self, network_id): self.enable_dhcp_helper(network_id) def network_update_end(self, context, payload): """ Handle the network.update.end notification event. Parses the message and then queues the operation. """ up = payload['network']['admin_state_up'] self.queue.put((self._handle_network_update, {"network_id": network_id, "up": up})) @utils.synchronized('dhcp-agent') def _handle_network_update(self, network_id, up): LOG.info("Network updated: %s. Up? %s", network_id, up) if up: def network_delete_end(self, context, payload): """ Handle the network.delete.end notification event. Parses the message and then queues the operation. """ network_id = payload['network_id'] LOG.info("Network deleted: %s. Up? %s", network_id) self.queue.put((self._handle_network_delete, {"network_id": network_id})) def _handle_network_delete(self, network_id): self.disable_dhcp_helper(network_id) def subnet_update_end(self, context, payload): """ Handle the subnet.update.end notification event. Parses the message and then queues the operation. """ LOG.info("Subnet updated, network %s", network_id) self.queue.put((self._handle_subnet_update, {"network_id": network_id})) @utils.synchronized('dhcp-agent') def _handle_subnet_update(self, network_id): def subnet_delete_end(self, context, payload): """ Handle the subnet.delete.end notification event. Parses the message and then queues the operation. """ self.queue.put((self._handle_subnet_delete, {"subnet_id": subnet_id})) def _handle_subnet_delete(self, subnet_id): LOG.info("Subnet deleted %s", subnet_id) network = self.cache.get_network_by_subnet_id(subnet_id) if network: LOG.debug("Network found, refreshing dhcp helper.") self.refresh_dhcp_helper(network.id) def port_update_end(self, context, payload): """ Handle the port.update.end notification event. Parses the message and then queues the operation. """ updated_port = dhcp.DictModel(payload['port']) self.queue.put((self._handle_port_update, {"updated_port": updated_port})) @utils.synchronized('dhcp-agent') def _handle_port_update(self, updated_port): network = self.cache.get_network_by_id(updated_port.network_id) LOG.info("Port updated: %s", updated_port.id) if network: LOG.debug("Network for port found, updating cache/driver.") if driver_action == 'reload_allocations': self.dirty_networks.add(updated_port.network_id) else: self.call_driver(driver_action, network) def port_delete_end(self, context, payload): """ Handle the port.delete.end notification event. Parses the message and then queues the operation. """ port_id = payload['port_id'] self.queue.put((self._handle_port_delete, {"port_id": port_id})) @utils.synchronized('dhcp-agent') def _handle_port_delete(self, port_id): port = self.cache.get_port_by_id(port_id) LOG.info("Port deleted: %s", port_id) if port: LOG.debug("Port %s found, updating cache/driver.", port_id) network = self.cache.get_network_by_id(port.network_id) self.dirty_networks.add(port.network_id)
deleted_lines: """Activate the DHCP agent.""" self.periodic_resync() @utils.exception_logger() def _periodic_resync_helper(self): """Resync the dhcp state at the configured interval.""" while True: eventlet.sleep(self.conf.resync_interval) if self.needs_resync_reasons: # be careful to avoid a race with additions to list # from other threads reasons = self.needs_resync_reasons self.needs_resync_reasons = collections.defaultdict(list) for net, r in reasons.items(): if not net: net = "*" LOG.debug("resync (%(network)s): %(reason)s", {"reason": r, "network": net}) self.sync_state(reasons.keys()) def periodic_resync(self): """Spawn a thread to periodically resync the dhcp state.""" eventlet.spawn(self._periodic_resync_helper) @utils.synchronized('dhcp-agent') def network_create_end(self, context, payload): """Handle the network.create.end notification event.""" self.enable_dhcp_helper(network_id) def network_update_end(self, context, payload): """Handle the network.update.end notification event.""" if payload['network']['admin_state_up']: @utils.synchronized('dhcp-agent') def network_delete_end(self, context, payload): """Handle the network.delete.end notification event.""" self.disable_dhcp_helper(payload['network_id']) def subnet_update_end(self, context, payload): """Handle the subnet.update.end notification event.""" @utils.synchronized('dhcp-agent') def subnet_delete_end(self, context, payload): """Handle the subnet.delete.end notification event.""" network = self.cache.get_network_by_subnet_id(subnet_id) if network: self.refresh_dhcp_helper(network.id) def port_update_end(self, context, payload): """Handle the port.update.end notification event.""" updated_port = dhcp.DictModel(payload['port']) network = self.cache.get_network_by_id(updated_port.network_id) if network: self.call_driver(driver_action, network) @utils.synchronized('dhcp-agent') def port_delete_end(self, context, payload): """Handle the port.delete.end notification event.""" port = self.cache.get_port_by_id(payload['port_id']) if port: network = self.cache.get_network_by_id(port.network_id) self.call_driver('reload_allocations', network)

commit_message:
Fix neutron bug 1525059
Add a new options "--provider:underlay_flooding_list" to net-create,
This option will be used to add VTEP whic is out of neutron to a VXLAN network.

Change-Id: Idfd116034b5237b35fb6f41c1a03f418a6c5f392
Partial-Bug: #1525059

commit_message:
optimize _update_arp_entry for internal subnets

Upstream methods like _process_arp_cache_for_internal_port
and _set_subnet_arp_info will call _update_arp_entry to
update arp entry for arp_entry/ports in subnet.

_update_arp_entry use subnet_id to create interface device
object and check device existence, it's not always so necessary.
_process_arp_cache_for_internal_port and _set_subnet_arp_info
can send device existence to _update_arp_entry to prevent
repeatedly calls to IPDevice.exists(), which will cost unnecessary
shell calls.

Closes-bug: #1514068
Change-Id: I840775070475df0242c4c50119b93875fd1da1fd

commit_message:
Add tag mechanism for resources other than network

Introduce a generic mechanism to allow the user to set tags
on Neutron resources.

APIImpact
DocImpact: allow users to set tags on resources other than network

Change-Id: I627fb9163d1fc43aa16b659f823d91537e312c28
Implements: blueprint add-tags-to-core-resources
Related-Bug: #1489291

commit_message:
Add reserved stamps to notify flows created by other than ovs agent.

Flows without a stamp shoud not be deleted by ovs agent.
This patch modifies not to delete flows created by other than ovs
agent.

Change-Id: Iab3dd8e48fd2f707c1253832c5f4394a3169163a
Closes-Bug: #1525775
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/85/257285/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Reserved stamps to notify flows created by other than ovs agent. # This value is set as cookie of a flow. # Currently, only the default value (0x0) is contained. # Coordination is required to avoid conflict of cookie with neutron # subprojects. OVS_RESERVED_STAMPS = [ 0x0 ]

commit_message:
port: add --no-fixed-ip option to allow port without subnet/ip address

Now Neutron could create a port without the IP address when the network
doesn't have a subnet. Allow neutronclient to make such subnet/port.

Partially Implements: blueprint vm-without-l3-address

Change-Id: I4218669fabd342fba483e18af1e5e4ff4090b009
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-neutronclient refs/changes/88/218388/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

duplicated assert

commit_message:
Increase default num_sync_threads of dhcp sync

Add recommendation and suggestion for higher performance.
Twice times faster when it increase to 16 with 1500+ networks

Change-Id: I7c1ba31fb1146be682819558f47a4837c5a7f0ea
Related-Bug: 1534587
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/39/268139/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: cfg.IntOpt('num_sync_threads', default=16,

commit_message:
Verify attributes inside a dict in request body

Currently if a dict in request body that has some wrong
attributes, No error will shown.
This patch called verify_attributes() in _validate_dict(), so that
attributes inside a dict will also be verified.

APIImpact
Change-Id: Ia859ae015642a3f8cfd8c54afe2450fa82aaef43
Closes-Bug: #1535626

commit_message:
Fix for adding gateway with IP outside subnet

Currently 'force_gateway_on_subnet' configuration is set to True
by default and enforces the subnet on to the gateway. With this
fix 'force_gateway_on_subnet' can be changed to False, and
gateway outside the subnet can be added.
Before adding the default route, a route to the gateway IP is
added. This applies to both external and internal networks.

Change-Id: I3a942cf98d263681802729cf09527f06c80fab2b
Closes-Bug: #1335023
Closes-Bug: #1398768
(cherry picked from commit b6126bc0f17f348ff6303b9bd6041cb018479ef9)
(cherry picked from commit 9e11c5b8516c42000d5409c0f44f852acb5fed3d)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/15/283415/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from neutron.db import db_base_plugin_v2 # Check for and remove the on-link route for the old # gateway being replaced, if it is outside the subnet is_old_gateway_not_in_subnet = ( gateway and not db_base_plugin_v2.NeutronDbPluginV2._check_subnet_ip( subnet.cidr, gateway)) if is_old_gateway_not_in_subnet: v4_onlink = device.route.list_onlink_routes( constants.IP_VERSION_4) v6_onlink = device.route.list_onlink_routes( constants.IP_VERSION_6) existing_onlink_routes = set( r['cidr'] for r in v4_onlink + v6_onlink) if gateway in existing_onlink_routes: device.route.delete_onlink_route(gateway) is_new_gateway_not_in_subnet = ( subnet.gateway_ip and not db_base_plugin_v2.NeutronDbPluginV2._check_subnet_ip( subnet.cidr, subnet.gateway_ip)) if is_new_gateway_not_in_subnet: device.route.add_onlink_route(subnet.gateway_ip)

commit_message:
Use Oslo Versioned serializer for RPC messages

VersionedObjectSerializer enable sending the OVO objects through RPC
instead of dicts.

Closes-bug: #1507654
Change-Id: Ib48ac62d2c9b3cc935fc925d6479c6e431b852c7

subject: PEP257: add flake8-docstring testing
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-13 01:42:39.000000000', 'files': ['test-requirements.txt', 'tox.ini'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/keystonemiddleware/commit/45a0d08532115adc78ad343726b5f70af66a2b55', 'message': 'PEP257: add flake8-docstring testing

PEP257 (https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0257/) aims to "standardize
the high-level structure of docstrings: what they should contain, and
how to say it (without touching on any markup syntax within docstrings).
The PEP contains conventions, not laws or syntax."

By having this flake8 extension installed as we do in other keystone
repositories, keystonemiddleware will be automatically gated against
PEP257 docstring conventions. Of course, we're also violating several
conventions here, all of which must be ignored to get the pep8 tox job
passing.

By fixing violations one at a time, we can then remove the ignore lines
in subsequent patches.

Change-Id: Icb329b7fb42172245a635d7c089858d66a6a19da
'}]
commit_message:
PEP257: add flake8-docstring testing

PEP257 (https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0257/) aims to "standardize
the high-level structure of docstrings: what they should contain, and
how to say it (without touching on any markup syntax within docstrings).
The PEP contains conventions, not laws or syntax."

By having this flake8 extension installed as we do in other keystone
repositories, keystonemiddleware will be automatically gated against
PEP257 docstring conventions. Of course, we're also violating several
conventions here, all of which must be ignored to get the pep8 tox job
passing.

By fixing violations one at a time, we can then remove the ignore lines
in subsequent patches.

Change-Id: Icb329b7fb42172245a635d7c089858d66a6a19da
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystonemiddleware refs/changes/25/304925/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # D100: Missing docstring in public module # D101: Missing docstring in public class # D102: Missing docstring in public method # D103: Missing docstring in public function # D104: Missing docstring in public package # D105: Missing docstring in magic method # D200: One-line docstring should fit on one line with quotes # D202: No blank lines allowed after function docstring # D204: 1 blank line required after class docstring # D209: Multi-line docstring closing quotes should be on a separate line # D301: Use r""" if any backslashes in a docstring # D400: First line should end with a period # D401: First line should be in imperative mood # H403: multi line docstrings should end on a new line ignore = D100,D101,D102,D103,D104,D105,D200,D202,D209,D301,D204,D400,D401,H403
deleted_lines: # NOTE(lbragstad): Even though we aren't ignoring any hacking checks, we have # to leave it assigned in the environment specification otherwise some error # checks will be ignored by default. If we need to ignore a specific hacking # check in the future, we will have to remove '___' from the ignore line. # See: http://flake8.readthedocs.org/en/latest/config.html#default ignore = ___

commit_message:
fix broken db sync

magnum::db::sync currently tries to use a pre-liberty command to
do the sync, and this command no longer exists. This commit changes
the command used and makes the db sync user configurable.

Change-Id: Ic949a25c18f9b8b6d8988c527508c4274a0f56f6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-magnum refs/changes/03/303903/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: exec { 'magnum-db-sync': command => "magnum-db-manage upgrade ${extra_params}", subscribe => [Package[$::magnum::params::api_package], Magnum_config['database/connection']], } Exec['magnum-db-manage upgrade'] ~> Service<| title == $::magnum::params::api_service |>
deleted_lines: exec { 'magnum-db-sync': command => "magnum-manage db_sync ${extra_params}", user => 'magnum', subscribe => [Package['magnum'], Magnum_config['database/connection']], } Exec['magnum-manage db_sync'] ~> Service<| title == 'magnum' |>

commit_message:
Generate ceph client key

By default only the admin user key is generated and this key is used
for both admin and openstack user.
Because the mode of the client's key file is 644, any user with a
valid shell on the controller/compute/ceph nodes can made admin
operations on the ceph cluster.
This patch allows to generate a random key for the openstack user that
will be used by tripleo-heat-templates.

Change-Id: I404665c09084f0a6cd2d8872940ee90220dc5f69
(cherry picked from commit adccde0cd572b5c4f2cc25d764afdcb9e1df5163)

commit_message:
add bp:client-manager-refactor

Refactor tempest client manager classes

Change-Id: I6469148f539c53680ed03835fe15b19912f83de9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/qa-specs refs/changes/04/92804/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode .. ========================= Refactor Client Managers ========================= https://blueprints.launchpad.net/tempest/+spec/client-manager-refactor The current client managers instantiate all possible clients at __init__ time and expose the clients via class attributes. Client managers shall be refactored to import and instantiate clients on demand, and serve them via get_* methods. Problem description =================== The current client managers instantiate all possible clients at __init__ time and expose the clients via class attributes. The problem with this is that regardlless of tempest configuration about available services, extensions and API versions, all clients are instantiated. For instance, in Manager class: .. if self.interface == 'xml': self.certificates_client = CertificatesClientXML( self.auth_provider) self.servers_client = ServersClientXML(self.auth_provider) self.limits_client = LimitsClientXML(self.auth_provider) self.images_client = ImagesClientXML(self.auth_provider) self.keypairs_client = KeyPairsClientXML(self.auth_provider) self.quotas_client = QuotasClientXML(self.auth_provider) self.flavors_client = FlavorsClientXML(self.auth_provider) :: And in OfficialClientManager: .. self.baremetal_client = self._get_baremetal_client() self.compute_client = self._get_compute_client(credentials) self.identity_client = self._get_identity_client(credentials) self.image_client = self._get_image_client() self.network_client = self._get_network_client() self.volume_client = self._get_volume_client(credentials) self.object_storage_client = self._get_object_storage_client( credentials) self.orchestration_client = self._get_orchestration_client( credentials) self.data_processing_client = self._get_data_processing_client( credentials) :: Another issue with the current structure is that new API versions lead to proliferation of client attributes in the client manager classes. Finally the current implementation does not enforce any specific structure in the folder and naming of the clients under tempest/services. Proposed change =============== Refactor client managers so that: - client manager classes are instantiated by credentials only. A client manager is a client factory that given a set of credentials can produce a variety of clients consuming the credentials - clients are only instantiated on demand - the manager internally caches instances of clients and serve them from cache where applicable - clients are server via get_* methods, which support client specific parameters, such as API version Example of the refactored __init__ for clients.Manager class: .. def __init__(self, credentials=None): # Set client type self.client_type = 'tempest' # super cares for credentials validation super(Manager, self).__init__(credentials=credentials) :: Example of the definition and usage of base get_client method: .. def get_client(service, api_version, api=None, type=None): """ Returns a client from cache or instantiates one """ client = self._from_cache(service, api_version, api, type) if client is None: client = self._get_client(service, api_version, api, type) return client # In an API test or test base class keypair_client = os.get_client("compute", (2,0), "keypair", "xml") # In a scenario test or test base class image_client = os.get_client("image", (1,0)) :: Additional helpers - client getters: .. def get_keypair_client(api_version, type): return get_client("compute", api_version, "keypair", type) def get_compute_client(api_version): return get_client("compute", api_version) :: Alternatives ------------ Leave the client manager as they are now, and accept the problems described in the "Problem description" section. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: Andrea Frittoli <andrea.frittoli@hp.com> Milestones ---------- Target Milestone for completion: Juno-2 Work Items ---------- - Define the new get_client method and cache objects in the manager. The get_client method initially will have to cope with different structure in naming and folders for the clients under tempest/services. - Define additional get_client helpers. - Consume the new get_* methods instead of manager attributes. This change will affect several classes, and can be split in multiple patches. - Remove the client instantiation from __init__ in the manager. - Align client naming and folder structure for the clients under tempest/services. This change may affect several classes and can be split in multiple patches. Dependencies ============ None

commit_message:
Make django 1.9 horizon job voting

The work to support Django 1.9 is complete in Horizon and the tests
are passing reliably. It's time to make the job voting to maintain
that support. Also adding to the gate jobs.

Change-Id: I7c0eea81ac033aef74af4f03c4e2aa3b9398a43d

commit_message:
Implement oslo::service define

Implement service define to configure oslo.service
parameters from DEFAULT and ssl sections.
Simple unit tests are added as well.

Change-Id: I6259150c78432d31ffad5999693744e790f947c4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-oslo refs/changes/89/305289/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # == Define: oslo::service # # Configure oslo_service options # # This resource configures Oslo service resources for an OpenStack service. # It will manage the [DEFAULT] and [ssl] sections in the given config resource. # # === Parameters: # # [DEFAULT] PARAMETERS # # [*api_paste_config*] # (optional) File name for the paste.deploy config for nova-api # (string value) # Defaults to $::os_service_default. # # [*backdoor_port*] # (optional) Enable eventlet backdoor. Acceptable values are 0, <port>, and # <start>:<end>, where 0 results in listening on a random tcp port number. # Defaults to $::os_service_default. # # [*backdoor_socket*] # (optional) Enable eventlet backdoor, using the provided path as a unix # socket that can receive connections. (string value) # Defaults to $::os_service_default. # # [*client_socket_timeout*] # (optional) Timeout for client connections' socket operations. A value of # '0' means wait forever. (integer value) # Defaults to $::os_service_default. # # [*graceful_shutdown_timeout*] # (optional) pecify a timeout after which a gracefully shutdown server will # exit. '0' value means endless wait. (integer value) # Defaults to $::os_service_default. # # [*log_options*] # (optional) Enables or disables logging values of all registered options # when starting a service (at DEBUG level). (boolean value) # Defaults to $::os_service_default. # # [*max_header_line*] # (optional) Maximum line size of message headers to be accepted. # (integer value) # Defaults to $::os_service_default. # # [*run_external_periodic_tasks*] # (optional) Some periodic tasks can be run in a separate process. # (boolean value) # Defaults to $::os_service_default. # # [*tcp_keepidle*] # (optional) # Sets the value of TCP_KEEPIDLE in seconds for each server socket. # (integer value) # Defaults to $::os_service_default. # # [*wsgi_default_pool_size*] # (optional) Size of the pool of greenthreads used by wsgi (integer value) # Defaults to $::os_service_default. # # [*wsgi_keep_alive*] # (optional) If False, closes the client socket connection explicitly. # (boolean value) # Defaults to $::os_service_default. # # [*wsgi_log_format*] # (optional) A python format string that is used as the template to generate # log lines. (string value) # Defaults to $::os_service_default. # Example: '%(client_ip)s "%(request_line)s" status: %(status_code)s len: \ # %(body_length)s time: %(wall_seconds).7f' # # [ssl] PARAMETERS # # [*ca_file*] # (optional) CA certificate file to use to verify connecting clients. # (string value) # Defaults to $::os_service_default. # # [*cert_file*] # (optional) Certificate file to use when starting the server securely. # (string value) # Defaults to $::os_service_default. # # [*ciphers*] # (optional) Sets the list of available ciphers. value should be a string # in the OpenSSL cipher list format. (string value) # Defaults to $::os_service_default. # # [*key_file*] # (optional) Private key file to use when starting the server securely. # (string value) # Defaults to $::os_service_default. # # [*version*] # (optional) SSL version to use (valid only if SSL enabled). Valid values are # TLSv1 and SSLv23. SSLv2, SSLv3, TLSv1_1, and TLSv1_2 may be available on # some distributions. (string value) # Defaults to $::os_service_default. # define oslo::service ( # [DEFAULT] parameters $api_paste_config = $::os_service_default, $backdoor_port = $::os_service_default, $backdoor_socket = $::os_service_default, $client_socket_timeout = $::os_service_default, $graceful_shutdown_timeout = $::os_service_default, $log_options = $::os_service_default, $max_header_line = $::os_service_default, $run_external_periodic_tasks = $::os_service_default, $tcp_keepidle = $::os_service_default, $wsgi_default_pool_size = $::os_service_default, $wsgi_keep_alive = $::os_service_default, $wsgi_log_format = $::os_service_default, # [ssl] parameters $ca_file = $::os_service_default, $cert_file = $::os_service_default, $ciphers = $::os_service_default, $key_file = $::os_service_default, $version = $::os_service_default, ) { $service_options = { 'DEFAULT/api_paste_config' => { value => $api_paste_config }, 'DEFAULT/backdoor_port' => { value => $backdoor_port }, 'DEFAULT/backdoor_socket' => { value => $backdoor_socket }, 'DEFAULT/client_socket_timeout' => { value => $client_socket_timeout }, 'DEFAULT/graceful_shutdown_timeout' => { value => $graceful_shutdown_timeout }, 'DEFAULT/log_options' => { value => $log_options }, 'DEFAULT/max_header_line' => { value => $max_header_line }, 'DEFAULT/run_external_periodic_tasks' => { value => $run_external_periodic_tasks }, 'DEFAULT/tcp_keepidle' => { value => $tcp_keepidle }, 'DEFAULT/wsgi_default_pool_size' => { value => $wsgi_default_pool_size }, 'DEFAULT/wsgi_keep_alive' => { value => $wsgi_keep_alive }, 'DEFAULT/wsgi_log_format' => { value => $wsgi_log_format }, 'ssl/ca_file' => { value => $ca_file }, 'ssl/cert_file' => { value => $cert_file }, 'ssl/ciphers' => { value => $ciphers }, 'ssl/key_file' => { value => $key_file }, 'ssl/version' => { value => $version }, } create_resources($name, $service_options) }

commit_message:
Remove times.dbm file for each tox run

If you run the py27 tox tests then attempt to run the py34 tests,
the following error will occur:

    running testr
    running=OS_STDOUT_CAPTURE=${OS_STDOUT_CAPTURE:-1} \
    OS_STDERR_CAPTURE=${OS_STDERR_CAPTURE:-1} \
    OS_TEST_TIMEOUT=${OS_TEST_TIMEOUT:-60} \
    ${PYTHON:-python} -m subunit.run discover -t ./ ./ --list
    db type could not be determined
    error: testr failed (3)

This happens because the apparently the times.dbm file generated
by py27 is not compatible with py34. The converse is not true though -
if you run py34 first, py27 will work.

Both these bugs have been filed against it, but I see no resolution
https://bugs.launchpad.net/testrepository/+bug/1212909
https://bugs.launchpad.net/testrepository/+bug/1229445

The work-around is to delete the file, which is what is now done
before running every tox test. Once the bug has been fixed, the
work-around can be removed.

Change-Id: Icf5d9efc65ffda8acdcc6f43b37ef03c84b3fd43
Closes-Bug: #1565928

commit_message:
Update source-branch-updater to work with IRR's

This updated the sources-branch-updater convenience script which
is used to update SHA's and ensure that all carried files are
appropriately included in the update.

The patch includes the following changes:

 - Automatically submit updates of applicable files to all the
   independent repositories.

 - Automatically update the ansible-role-requirements.yml file
   with the latest SHA from the independent repositories or the
   latest tag from any repositories that are not part of OSA.
   This functionality is disabled by design for the master branch.

 - Adds ansible-role-requirements-editer.py which provides the
   ability to edit the ansible-role-requirements.yml file
   appropriately and output a consistent result.

Change-Id: I67fadeb43cc65a557d0380a12eb3e94335097d0d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/83/297083/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: OS_BRANCH=${OS_BRANCH:-"master"} OSA_BRANCH=${OSA_BRANCH:-"$OS_BRANCH"} -b|--openstack-branch (name of OpenStack branch, eg: stable/mitaka) -o|--osa-branch (name of the OSA branch, eg: stable/mitaka) -s|--service-file (path to service file to parse) -b|--openstack-branch) OS_BRANCH="$2" shift ;; -o|--osa-branch) OSA_BRANCH="$2" branch_data=$(git ls-remote ${repo_address} | grep "${OS_BRANCH}$") branch_entry="${branch_sha} # HEAD of \"$OS_BRANCH\" as of $(date +%d.%m.%Y)" os_repo_tmp_path="/tmp/os_${repo_name}" osa_repo_tmp_path="/tmp/osa_${repo_name}" rm -rf ${os_repo_tmp_path} ${osa_repo_tmp_path} # Do a shallow clone of the OpenStack repo to work with git clone --quiet --depth=10 --branch ${OS_BRANCH} --no-checkout --single-branch ${repo_address} ${os_repo_tmp_path} pushd ${os_repo_tmp_path} > /dev/null # Set the OSA address if [[ "${repo_name}" == "ironic" ]]; then osa_repo_address="https://git.openstack.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-ironic" else osa_repo_address="https://git.openstack.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_${repo_name}" fi # Do a shallow clone of the OSA repo to work with git clone --quiet --depth=10 --branch ${OSA_BRANCH} --single-branch ${osa_repo_address} ${osa_repo_tmp_path} find ${os_repo_tmp_path}/etc -name "policy.json" -exec \ cp {} "${osa_repo_tmp_path}/templates/policy.json.j2" \; find ${os_repo_tmp_path}/etc -name "*[_-]paste.ini" -exec \ find ${os_repo_tmp_path}/etc -name "*[_-]paste.ini" -exec \ bash -c "name=\"{}\"; cp \${name} \"${osa_repo_tmp_path}/templates/\$(basename \${name}).j2\"" \; find ${os_repo_tmp_path}/etc -name "rootwrap.conf" -exec \ find ${os_repo_tmp_path}/etc -name "rootwrap.conf" -exec \ cp {} "${osa_repo_tmp_path}/templates/rootwrap.conf.j2" \; find ${os_repo_tmp_path}/etc -name "*.filters" -exec \ bash -c "name=\"{}\"; cp \${name} \"${osa_repo_tmp_path}/files/rootwrap.d/\$(basename \${name})\"" \; find ${os_repo_tmp_path}/etc -name "*.yaml" -exec \ bash -c "name=\"{}\"; cp \${name} \"${osa_repo_tmp_path}/templates/\$(basename \${name}).j2\"" \; find ${os_repo_tmp_path}/etc -name "*.yaml" -exec \ bash -c "name=\"{}\"; cp \${name} \"${osa_repo_tmp_path}/templates/\$(echo \${name} | rev | cut -sd / -f -2 | rev).j2\"" \; # Switch into the OSA git directory to work with it pushd ${osa_repo_tmp_path} > /dev/null # Check for changed files git_changed=$(git status --porcelain | wc -l) # Check for untracked files git_untracked=$(git ls-files --other --exclude-standard --directory | wc -l) if [ ${git_untracked} -gt 0 ]; then # If there are untracked files, ensure that the commit message includes # a WIP prefix so that the patch is revised in more detail. git_msg_prefix="[New files - needs update] " else git_msg_prefix="" fi # If any files have changed, submit a patch including the changes if [ ${git_changed} -gt 0 ]; then git review -s > /dev/null git add --all git commit -a -m "${git_msg_prefix}Update paste, policy and rootwrap configurations $(date +%Y-%m-%d)" --quiet git review > /dev/null fi popd > /dev/null rm -rf ${os_repo_tmp_path} ${osa_repo_tmp_path}
deleted_lines: ONLINE_BRANCH=${ONLINE_BRANCH:-"master"} -b|--branch (name of branch, eg: stable/liberty) -s|--service-file (path to service file to parse) -b|--branch) ONLINE_BRANCH="$2" branch_data=$(git ls-remote ${repo_address} | grep "${ONLINE_BRANCH}$") branch_entry="${branch_sha} # HEAD of \"$ONLINE_BRANCH\" as of $(date +%d.%m.%Y)" repo_tmp_path="/tmp/${repo_name}" rm -rf ${repo_tmp_path} # Do a shallow clone of the repo to work with git clone --quiet --depth=10 --branch ${ONLINE_BRANCH} --no-checkout --single-branch ${repo_address} ${repo_tmp_path} pushd ${repo_tmp_path} > /dev/null find ${repo_tmp_path}/etc -name "policy.json" -exec \ cp {} "playbooks/roles/os_${repo_name}/templates/policy.json.j2" \; find ${repo_tmp_path}/etc -name "*[_-]paste.ini" -exec \ find ${repo_tmp_path}/etc -name "*[_-]paste.ini" -exec \ bash -c "name=\"{}\"; cp \${name} \"playbooks/roles/os_${repo_name}/templates/\$(basename \${name}).j2\"" \; find ${repo_tmp_path}/etc -name "rootwrap.conf" -exec \ find ${repo_tmp_path}/etc -name "rootwrap.conf" -exec \ cp {} "playbooks/roles/os_${repo_name}/templates/rootwrap.conf.j2" \; find ${repo_tmp_path}/etc -name "*.filters" -exec \ bash -c "name=\"{}\"; cp \${name} \"playbooks/roles/os_${repo_name}/files/rootwrap.d/\$(basename \${name})\"" \; find ${repo_tmp_path}/etc -name "*.yaml" -exec \ bash -c "name=\"{}\"; cp \${name} \"playbooks/roles/os_${repo_name}/templates/\$(basename \${name}).j2\"" \; find ${repo_tmp_path}/etc -name "*.yaml" -exec \ bash -c "name=\"{}\"; cp \${name} \"playbooks/roles/os_${repo_name}/templates/\$(echo \${name} | rev | cut -sd / -f -2 | rev).j2\"" \; rm -rf ${repo_tmp_path}

commit_message:
Remove fake methods code from compute network

Network objects don't have any method needs to fake.

keys() method is only used by _get_columns() helper
to obtain all attributes of an object. But in compute
network implementation, attributes are obtained from
obj._info directly, which is a dictionary itself. So
there is no need to fake this method.

Change-Id: Ie6a46ef6a3042641e55a7002573ef501db7b60e1

added_lines: def create_one_security_group(attrs=None): def create_security_groups(attrs=None, count=2): FakeSecurityGroup.create_one_security_group(attrs)) def create_one_network(attrs={}): def create_networks(attrs={}, count=2): networks.append(FakeNetwork.create_one_network(attrs))
deleted_lines: def create_one_security_group(attrs=None, methods=None): :param Dictionary methods: A dictionary with all methods if methods is None: methods = {} # Set default methods. security_group_methods = { 'keys': ['id', 'name', 'description', 'tenant_id', 'rules'], } # Overwrite default methods. security_group_methods.update(methods) methods=copy.deepcopy(security_group_methods), def create_security_groups(attrs=None, methods=None, count=2): :param Dictionary methods: A dictionary with all methods FakeSecurityGroup.create_one_security_group(attrs, methods)) def create_one_network(attrs={}, methods={}): :param Dictionary methods: A dictionary with all methods # Set default methods. network_methods = { 'keys': ['id', 'label', 'cidr'], } # Overwrite default methods. network_methods.update(methods) methods=copy.deepcopy(network_methods), def create_networks(attrs={}, methods={}, count=2): :param Dictionary methods: A dictionary with all methods networks.append(FakeNetwork.create_one_network(attrs, methods))

commit_message:
Add new NeutronFloatingIP object

Because floating IPs in Neutron have UUIDs for ids, a new object for
floating IPs needs to be made that can hold a UUID instead of an integer
in the id field. Fixed IPs also have UUIDs, so the fixed_ip_id field in
the floating IP object also needs to have a UUID.

Change-Id: I939c3b9d9c8f0bf5c9e441d054dc72ef8e8acd70

added_lines: @obj_base.NovaObjectRegistry.register_if(False) class NeutronFloatingIP(FloatingIP): # Version 1.0: Initial Version VERSION = '1.0' fields = { 'id': fields.UUIDField(), 'fixed_ip_id': fields.UUIDField(nullable=True) }

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-docs refs/changes/91/305391/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: * Changed the Fuel serialization process to fix the Nailgun behavior in complex OVS+VLAN network environments with multiple node groups and network templates. Previously, it was impossible to use network templates and multiple node groups with OVS+VLAN Neutron providers due to unnumbered ``br-prv`` networks. See `LP1556917 <https://bugs.launchpad.net/fuel/+bug/1556917>`_.

Charmhelpers Resync

The fix to bug
https://bugs.launchpad.net/charms/+source/glance/+bug/1565120
requires a resync of all charms that use the ceph charmhelpers code.

commit_message:
Keep setting backend_host to 'hostgroup' for rbd backends

There are backwards incompatible patches [1][2] in puppet-cinder which break
upgrade scenarios, but at this point they made it to liberty and mitaka,
so workaround in t-h-t is easier than revert

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/209412/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/231068/

Change-Id: Ic82258bf0893ebd4e595e5df73ffbc4c6443f9e8
Closes-Bug: #1570265
(cherry picked from commit 2b15978ba0ef9843345db18aabb2f999d4535381)

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-web refs/changes/95/303195/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: editable = { 'storage': { 'metadata': { 'label': 'Storage Backends', 'weight': 60, 'group': 'storage' } } } 'attributes_metadata': jsonutils.dumps({ 'editable': editable }) cluster_id = result.inserted_primary_key[0] db.execute( meta.tables['attributes'].insert(), [{ 'cluster_id': cluster_id, 'editable': jsonutils.dumps(editable) }]) class TestCephAttributesMigration(base.BaseAlembicMigrationTest): def test_ceph_cluster_attrs(self): ceph_opts = ['fsid', 'mon_key', 'admin_key', 'bootstrap_osd_key', 'radosgw_key'] clusters_attributes = self.meta.tables['attributes'] results = db.execute( sa.select([clusters_attributes.c.editable]) ).fetchall() for cluster_attrs_row in results: cluster_attrs = jsonutils.loads(cluster_attrs_row[0]) for ceph_opt in ceph_opts: self.assertIn(ceph_opt, cluster_attrs['storage']) def test_ceph_release_attrs(self): ceph_opts = ['fsid', 'mon_key', 'admin_key', 'bootstrap_osd_key', 'radosgw_key'] releases = self.meta.tables['releases'] results = db.execute( sa.select([releases.c.attributes_metadata]) .where(releases.c.state != 'unavailable') ).fetchall() for release_attrs_row in results: release_attrs = jsonutils.loads(release_attrs_row[0]) for ceph_opt in ceph_opts: self.assertIn(ceph_opt, release_attrs['editable']['storage'])

commit_message:
Add a test for deleting pending zones

Change-Id: I50eb1f87db90af00b3b3179c9e27a87cdf230a84
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/designate-tempest-plugin refs/changes/05/305105/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @test.attr(type='slow') @test.idempotent_id('c9838adf-14dc-4097-9130-e5cea3727abb') def test_delete_zone_pending_create(self): LOG.info('Create a zone') _, zone = self.client.create_zone() self.addCleanup(self.client.delete_zone, zone['id']) # NOTE(kiall): This is certainly a little racey, it's entirely # possible the zone will become active before we delete # it. Worst case, that means we get an unexpected pass. # Theres not a huge amount we can do, given this is # back-box testing. LOG.info('Delete the zone while it is still pending') _, body = self.client.delete_zone(zone['id']) LOG.info('Ensure we respond with DELETE+PENDING') self.assertEqual('DELETE', body['action']) self.assertEqual('PENDING', body['status']) waiters.wait_for_zone_404(self.client, zone['id'])

commit_message:
Fix handlers

The handler to restart mysql is using an incorrect registered variable
to check if the restart succeeded, leading to multiple service restarts
each time its notified.

The 'Remove stale .sst' and 'Restart mysql fall back' handlers will only
be notified if 'Restart mysql' is 'changed', but their when clauses
were checking for 'failed'. Regardless, their when clauses can be
removed.

Change-Id: Icc038d17b560b24bb9bf5fdd523835102ca97030
(cherry picked from commit a94f88dddc15c6146ef305656a4f5df1937b5776)

deleted_lines: until: galera_restart_fall_back | success - "remove stale .sst"- name: remove stale .sst when: galera_restart | failed when: galera_restart | failed

commit_message:
Removing tox ignore D401 and make keystoneauth compliant

Currently tox ignores D401 (401: First line should be in imperative mood).
This change removes it and make keystoneauth docstring compliantwith it.

Change-Id: Ia3bc1ecf0d2bd9699e9a1a549f9995c008db233c

commit_message:
Add wip wrapper

I saw in keystone they had this nice WIP wrapper that
allows people to add tests and add a `wip` wrapper. If
the test fails then the test is skipped otherwise if
the test passes then an exception is raised showing
that you have fixed the problem and the wrapper can
be removed. This is beneficial for people who are
trying to prove there is a problem before they
fix the problem.

Change-Id: I599f081655347c272f08e9bbd161125be338b23d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslotest refs/changes/62/298862/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. """Utility function for adding work in progress tests to a project. """ from testtools import testcase class wip(object): """Mark a test as work in progress. Based on code by Nat Pryce: https://gist.github.com/npryce/997195#file-wip-py The test will always be run. If the test fails then a TestSkipped exception is raised. If the test passes an AssertionError exception is raised so that the developer knows they made the test pass. This is a reminder to remove the decorator. :param message: a string message to help clarify why the test is marked as a work in progress usage: >>> @wip('waiting on bug #000000') >>> def test(): >>> pass """ def __init__(self, message): self.message = message def __call__(self, f): def _wip(*args, **kwargs): try: f(*args, **kwargs) except Exception: raise testcase.TestSkipped('work in progress test failed: ' + self.message) raise AssertionError('work in progress test passed: ' + self.message) return _wip

run_test.sh don't accept --nologcapture , so we'd better remove
the relevant statement.

deleted_lines: Suppressing logging output when tests fail ------------------------------------------ By default, when one or more unit test fails, all of the data sent to the logger during the failed tests will appear on standard output, which typically consists of many lines of texts. The logging output can make it difficult to identify which specific tests have failed, unless your terminal has a large scrollback buffer or you have redirected output to a file. You can suppress the logging output by calling ``run_tests.sh`` with the nose flag:: --nologcapture

commit_message:
Add hieradata override file

Adds a new configuration option for instack-undercloud,
hieradata_override. The option can be set to a path to a hieradata file
that can contain any custom hieradata.

When set, the file will be copied under /etc/puppet/hieradata and
configured as the first file in the hiera hierarchy in
/etc/puppet/hiera.yaml.

This allows for configuring any option for any service that is
configured via puppet (and exposes a way to configure options in its
module).

This should help with the increasing need to represent more and
more options in undercloud.conf.

Change-Id: If25ea0976d568d84317d8c70584150b56446ab64

commit_message:
Do Not Merge: Test stack-update

This patch tests Ifb1e62cc6ca824261fba7b2e190c627d8b537450 along with a
proposed change to tripleo-heat-templates.

In the upgrades CI job, we should be able to see the version of
openstack-tripleo-heat-templates installed from delorean-current before
the overcloud deploy, and then the version of delorean-ci installed
before the overcloud update.

Change-Id: I22173c4d39e0e047783c085f5ddc6986ac3dec0e
Depends-On: Ifb1e62cc6ca824261fba7b2e190c627d8b537450

commit_message:
resource state config documentation review

Change-Id: Id5f6c0903dac65c221ca6d85b1b7852f14676a4b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/vitrage refs/changes/94/304594/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Overview -------- Vitrage retrieves information from diverse data-sources regarding alarms in the cloud, and stores and combines this information into a unified system model. An important property of a resource is its **state**. This state can be used both in the Vitrage templates to trigger actions, and in the Horizon UI for color-coding purposes. Therefore, it is important that within the Vitrage data model, state names are normalized. Since each data-source might represent state differently, for each data-source we can supply it's own mapping to the normalized state supported in Vitrage. This page explains how to handle this mapping for a given data-source. The resource state configuration is handled via config files. The location of these files can be determined in **/etc/vitrage/vitrage.conf**. Under the [entity_graph] section, set:The resource state configuration files configure how the state of each resource is normalized. Some guidelines for creating a config file: - Normalized state values which can be mapped to can be found in normalized_resource_state.py (NormalizedResourceState class). - Each normalized state also comes with a priority, so that if a resource is given different states from different sources (e.g., a host state set both by nagios and Vitrage), the state with the highest priority will be used as the **aggregated state**. - The *UNKNOWN* state will be used for states with no corresponding normalized state. This state *must* appear in the config file. - The config file is in YAML format. - The config filename must be <datasource name>.yaml, for the relevant datasource. - Defining a config file for each datasource is recommended, but not mandatory. Datasources with no such configuration will use the values as-is. Default Configuration +++++++++++++++++++++ Default configurations for resource states will be installed with Vitrage for all the pre-packaged data-sources. Format ++++++ category: RESOURCE values: - normalized value: name: <normalized resource state> priority: <resource state priority - an integer> original values: - name: <Original resource state name> - name: ... # can list several states for one normalized - normalized value: name: ... # can list several normalized states ... Example +++++++
deleted_lines: The following should be set in **/etc/vitrage/vitrage.conf**, under entity_graph section:Resource state configuration is made to configure how states of specific resource are normalized. For each normalized state a priority is set as well, so that when resource will have the original state and the Vitrage state, Vitrage will know what state is more important. UNRECOGNIZED state has to be configured in each resource state configuration file. The file name has to be in the same name as it's plugin name. State configuration yaml file has to be defined for all the plugins which were chosen to be used in Vitrage. **Format** category: RESOURCE values: - normalized value: name: <Normalized resource value name - must be from NormalizedResourcevalue class> priority: <Resource value priority - an integer> original values: - name: <Original resource value name> - name: <Original resource value name> - normalized value: name: <Normalized resource value name - must be from NormalizedResourcevalue class> priority: <Resource value priority - an integer> original values: - name: <Original resource value name> - name: <Original resource value name>**Example** **Default Configuration** Default configurations for resource values will be installed with Vitrage.

commit_message:
Move successfull policy checks to trace

We use policy .. a lot ..

on an inactive system, we log at least 2-3 checks a
second (at INFO!).

We should log failures at info, and remain silent for the rest.

if we need to enable TRACE logging (for debugging) we can
add:

  'designate.policy=TRACE',

 to the log.set_defaults() call in designate/__init__.py

Change-Id: I2d059be9a5a127a687d0cb2cd02fa4915d1b6195

commit_message:
Transpile Intern tests before executing them

Before using Babel 6 there was no way to use ES6 for Intern-based
functional tests, as Intern requires AMD modules. Since Babel 6 allows
to choose module format by adding proper module transformation plugin,
we can start using ES6 for the tests. This commit just adds
transpiling, without actually converting the code to use ES6 syntax.

Change-Id: Iddf0622f5759faead45cb530e05954a29ffebb01

commit_message:
Fix storage not swift to backup nova or cinder

When backup instances or volumes, if we use storage is
"local" or "ssh",it is fail to OpenStack certification.
This patch would fix it,that storage is any one in swift,
local or ssh.

Change-Id: I3afb0b0c40b0f6fbf5b063b232044ae583d08f86
Closes-Bug: #1568238

commit_message:
Improve dictionary representation of package from Glare

Several keys added to dictionary representation of package imported
from Glare to match packages from murano.
Thus, dashboard API works in a similar way, no matter what backend
is used.
It also allows dashboard to filter applications by category and by
some text in name, description or tags.

Change-Id: Ia08a0629e55b8fa318b787d87bb3a2f793cb2a2a
Closes-bug: #1561935

commit_message:
Add missing services ports to service_ports map

AODH, Gnocchi, Sahara and Trove were missing from the service_ports
maps and thus had hardcoded ports in the listener configuration. The
addition of those ports to the map is required to give the
possibility to deployers to configure those ports if needed. This
commit adds them to that map.

Change-Id: Id009d65bf68ba91f97b0d60d32028da50fc88fc3

commit_message:
Fix comparison to control_virtual_ip

When managing the vip's, we were incorrectly comparing the vip to
$control_virtual_interface instead of $controller_virtual_ip when
determining if we needed to actually create the vip or not.

This caused the vips for internal api, storage, and storage mgmt to
always be created even if they were the same as the control vip. Afaict,
this didn't actually cause any problems, other than having extra vip's
created when they weren't needed. Still, this corrects the code to do
what it was intended to do.

Change-Id: I29aee95afcba25008b8b7bee37ba636eb2595cca

commit_message:
API tests should be fast, Scenario tests slow

In general, our API tests should aim to be fast - i.e. no waiting around for
zones to become ACTIVE etc.

On the other hand, our scenario tests should cover more real world scenarios,
for example, create a domain, waiting for it to become active, then deleting
it.

Change-Id: Id0779110cebf77db3a36ded1aef81382fbf641e0

commit_message:
Don't hide cacert when insecure == False

Currently 'insecure' wins over 'cacert' when both are provided in an
os_cloud_config config during verify argument computation which means
cacert is wrongly hidden when 'insecure' is provided and equals to
False.

This change sets verify to:
 * False when insecure is True
 * cacert when cacert is provided and insecure is False or not provided

Change-Id: Iecec08fd4a80121b2e20ac65e5ba4c7ef5201935

deleted_lines: if 'insecure' in cloud_config.config: auth['verify'] = not bool(cloud_config.config['insecure'])

commit_message:
Add GlanceRegistry to the endpoint map

This patch adds GlanceRegistry to the endpoint map. This
will make accessing Glance registry setings via the endpoint
map possible.

Change-Id: I9186e56cd4746a60e65dc5ac12e6595ac56505f0

subject: Wait for the interfaces to get IP addresses before inspection
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-01 15:13:00.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic-python-agent/commit/e323a7ca7e57fcf2ef9a1d0550d9e056a4b59f8b', 'message': "Wait for the interfaces to get IP addresses before inspection

In the DIB build the DHCP code (provided by the dhcp-all-interfaces element)
races with the service starting IPA. It does not matter for deployment itself,
as we're waiting for the route to the Ironic API to appear. However, for
inspection it may result in reporting back all NIC's without IP addresses.
Inspection fails in this case.

This change introduces a loop in the inspection code waiting for all interfaces
to receive IP addresses with a short (60 seconds) timeout. After the loop
inspection proceedes in any case, so the worst downside is making inspection
60 seconds longer.

Closes-Bug: #1564954
Change-Id: I5bf14de4c1c622f4bf6e3eadbe20c44759da5d66
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-04-01 16:09:06.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic-python-agent/commit/15fa634e6787fbe1dec433f5fd8039e7419188a8', 'message': "Wait for the interfaces to get IP addresses before inspection

In the DIB build the DHCP code (provided by the dhcp-all-interfaces element)
races with the service starting IPA. It does not matter for deployment itself,
as we're waiting for the route to the Ironic API to appear. However, for
inspection it may result in reporting back all NIC's without IP addresses.
Inspection fails in this case.

This change introduces a loop in the inspection code waiting for all interfaces
to receive IP addresses with a short (60 seconds) timeout. After the loop
inspection proceedes in any case, so the worst downside is making inspection
60 seconds longer.

Closes-Bug: #1564954
Change-Id: I5bf14de4c1c622f4bf6e3eadbe20c44759da5d66
"}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2016-04-05 13:05:04.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic-python-agent/commit/a99e6c9a3b36e6b76cbbd6ca04b5f196a1585a3a', 'message': "Wait for the interfaces to get IP addresses before inspection

In the DIB build the DHCP code (provided by the dhcp-all-interfaces element)
races with the service starting IPA. It does not matter for deployment itself,
as we're waiting for the route to the Ironic API to appear. However, for
inspection it may result in reporting back all NIC's without IP addresses.
Inspection fails in this case.

This change introduces a new hardware manager call wait_for_ip_addresses with
the default implementation in the base HardwareManager class. It waits for all
interfaces to get their IP addresses up for a short (60 seconds by default)
timeout. This call is used in the inspection code before getting the whole
inventory. After the wait inspection proceedes in any case, so the worst downside
is making inspection 60 seconds longer.

In the future the same code might be used to avoid failing and retrying during
lookup, but that's our of scope for this patch.

Closes-Bug: #1564954
Change-Id: I5bf14de4c1c622f4bf6e3eadbe20c44759da5d66
"}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2016-04-05 13:11:54.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic-python-agent/commit/0765e04b4295e575d25005b2d60d42c1595c058c', 'message': "Wait for the interfaces to get IP addresses before inspection

In the DIB build the DHCP code (provided by the dhcp-all-interfaces element)
races with the service starting IPA. It does not matter for deployment itself,
as we're waiting for the route to the Ironic API to appear. However, for
inspection it may result in reporting back all NIC's without IP addresses.
Inspection fails in this case.

This change introduces a new hardware manager call wait_for_ip_addresses with
the default implementation in the base HardwareManager class. It waits for all
interfaces to get their IP addresses up for a short (60 seconds by default)
timeout. This call is used in the inspection code before getting the whole
inventory. After the wait inspection proceedes in any case, so the worst downside
is making inspection 60 seconds longer.

In the future the same code might be used to avoid failing and retrying during
lookup, but that's our of scope for this patch.

commit_message:
Wait for the interfaces to get IP addresses before inspection

In the DIB build the DHCP code (provided by the dhcp-all-interfaces element)
races with the service starting IPA. It does not matter for deployment itself,
as we're waiting for the route to the Ironic API to appear. However, for
inspection it may result in reporting back all NIC's without IP addresses.
Inspection fails in this case.

This change makes inspection wait for *all* NIC's to get their IP addresses up
to a small timeout. The timeout is 60 seconds by default and can be changed
via the new ipa-inspection-dhcp-wait-timeout kernel option (0 to not wait).

After the wait inspection proceedes in any case, so the worst downside
is making inspection 60 seconds longer.

To avoid waiting for NIC's that are not even connected, this change extends the
NetworkInterface class with 'has_carrier' field.

Closes-Bug: #1564954
Change-Id: I5bf14de4c1c622f4bf6e3eadbe20c44759da5d66
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-python-agent refs/changes/48/300548/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import time_NETWORK_WAIT_ATTEMPTS = 10 _NETWORK_WAIT_DELAY = 3 def _wait_for_ips(): """Wait for IP addresses to appear for all interfaces. :return: inventory from the last iteration """ for attempt in range(_NETWORK_WAIT_ATTEMPTS): inventory = hardware.dispatch_to_managers('list_hardware_info') missing = [iface.name for iface in inventory['interfaces'] if not iface.ipv4_address] if not missing: return inventory LOG.debug('Still waiting for interfaces %s to get IP addressed', missing) time.sleep(_NETWORK_WAIT_DELAY) LOG.warning('Not all network interfaces received IP addresses in ' '%(timeout)d seconds: %(missing)s', {'timeout': _NETWORK_WAIT_DELAY * _NETWORK_WAIT_ATTEMPTS, 'missing': missing}) return inventory inventory = _wait_for_ips()

commit_message:
Zero Downtime Re-indexing Functional Tests.

See spec:
http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/searchlight-specs/specs/mitaka/zero-downtime-reindexing.html

This patch adds functional tests for the Zero Downtime functionality.

Partially-Implements-blueprint: zero-downtime-reindexing

commit_message:
Fix offline building of fuel-library deb package

Include upstream_modules.tar.gz to the source tar.gz
in case we are building the fuel-library package.

Change-Id: Iaeaaaa47f5c13b501fd4c0e0c63f51af57dcf925
Closes-Bug: #1570331
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-main refs/changes/94/305894/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if [ "$1" = "fuel-library$(FUEL_LIBRARY_VERSION)" ]; then cd $(BUILD_DIR)/packages/sources/$1 && tar -rf $1.tar upstream_modules.tar.gz; fi

commit_message:
Fixing keepalived bug when 2+ backup nodes have the same priority

The issue is present if you're running 2 or more nodes with
a keepalived < 1.2.8. This bumps the version of keepalived role
(installing a more recent version of keepalived by default) AND
edits the keepalived configuration file to avoid having nodes
with the same priority.

This will restart your keepalived service.

Please note this commit is not meant for backporting. The deployer
running on mitaka and below should follow the documentation here:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/279664/

Bug: #1545066

Change-Id: Ie28d2d3fa8670212c64ecbdf5a87314e7ca0a2d9

commit_message:
Generate Self-Signed Cert with SubjectAltNames

A new version of python urllib send us ugly warnings because our SSL
certificates don't have SubjectAltNames.

I re-generated some SSL certs with it, for both ipv4 & ipv6 deployments.

Change-Id: Ibed9f23869de9d2871c3d25e9bd24df809aa4c16
(cherry picked from commit e645272ef304fe3fa1ef43879a1b9524236c34fd)

commit_message:
stable/mitaka: bump mitaka

Until we get to GA, we still need some patches and we need this bump
because Trove looks broken.

So we need to land this patch, and then backport some patches from
master and then bump to GA repo and it should work.

Change-Id: I5895a58375a12cfee121193e9328a70c7df133f9

commit_message:
Fix offline building of fuel-library deb package

Include upstream_modules.tar.gz to the source tar.gz
in case we are building the fuel-library package.

Change-Id: Iaeaaaa47f5c13b501fd4c0e0c63f51af57dcf925
Closes-Bug: #1570331

commit_message:
rabbitmq: use $::package_provider fact

Switch package_provider to use $::package_provider fact present in
puppetlabs-stdlib.

It will avoid any collision later.

Change-Id: I2df1bff1b911c22eed8a2f6b9c0ab38edda43156
(cherry picked from commit e22fe0ed9b190e29e2a1e8f24e1f9c0d75c86673)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-openstack-integration refs/changes/78/305578/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: package_provider => $::package_provider, package_provider => $::package_provider,
deleted_lines: case $::osfamily { 'Debian': { $package_provider = 'apt' } 'RedHat': { $package_provider = 'yum' } default: { fail("Unsupported osfamily (${::osfamily})") } } package_provider => $package_provider, package_provider => $package_provider,

commit_message:
Allow for recent ironic sample config changes

In I1bc8b00eb98055a6e0f06af287cfa10c02ee2094 the
sample ironic.conf file was modified to prepare
for the transition to oslo-config-generator. Since
bifrost uses the sample config file, we need to
modify our regexps to match both the new and old
sample config file. We also need to replace lines
with the new style.

Change-Id: I1757cc26c7f687b8070ca1f9c61a933fbcee8774

commit_message:
Adds missing attribute from get_cpus_info query

There is a new field added in cpu_info called MaxClockSpeed.
The field is not included in the query so its value will not
be retrieved with the query and it will be always None.

This patch adds the missing field in the query in order
to retrieve its value.

Closes-Bug: #1570345

Change-Id: Ie6d531ccd9fdb74c700dc6f52674d46838f5ee1a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/os-win refs/changes/71/305771/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fix and simplify 'ClusterIPField'

ClusterIPField purpose is to validate IP to belong to env's subnet.
It is now impossible since environments are not assosiated with
particular subnets, at least on the creation stage.
We can leave simple validation of IP syntax in this field.

Change-Id: I50d809d6a99176f511e376ffbb6db1011303122c
Closes-bug: #1537066

(get the state as a parameter) for better code reuse .

commit_message:
Use default value of kombu_reconnect_delay for all services

Current reconnection time is 5.0 which is pretty long.
This patch switches kombu_reconnect_delay to its default
value - 1.0 which is the same for all services.

Change-Id: Id7bac2d1988b9f91ea19edc0fe8a4bdc9958d458
Closes-bug: #1560097
(cherry picked from commit b284426e062f0c29a0c214782313ea52a25c92c6)

Update min_ansible_version to 1.9

This role makes use of the ternary filter which was only introduced in
Ansible 1.9, this patch updates the min_ansible_version to 1.9.

commit_message:
Add option to enable from VPNaaS in Horizon

This change simple provides an option to enable vpnaas panels
within horizon.

commit_message:
Update min_ansible_version to 1.9

This role makes use of the ternary filter which was only introduced in
Ansible 1.9, this patch updates the min_ansible_version to 1.9.

Change-Id: I9615fe04b5f3772e41087ae9142276dd8e442ab1

commit_message:
WIP: Update nova to take advantage of exact VIO

Waiting on pypowervm change

Live Migration requires that a given fabric is matched to an exact
number of VIOSes.  This change enables this enforcement during a live
migration.

Change-Id: I89c15e6399986caff024e7c9aeb43afffbaffa15
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-powervm refs/changes/17/241017/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: mig_data['npiv_fabric_vioses_%s' % fabric] = ( self._get_unique_vios_count(fabric)) exact_vios_count = src_mig_data['npiv_fabric_vioses_%s' % fabric] vios_wraps, self._fabric_ports(fabric), slots, number_of_vioses=exact_vios_count, vios_enforcement=pvm_vfcm.VIO_EXACTLY) def _get_unique_vios_count(self, fabric): """Returns the number of unique VIOSes used for a given fabric.""" vios_wraps = self.stg_ftsk.feed npiv_maps = self._get_fabric_meta(fabric) unique_vio_uuids = set() for npiv_map in npiv_maps: for vios_wrap in vios_wraps: if npiv_map[0] in vios_wrap.get_pfc_wwpns(): unique_vio_uuids.add(vios_wrap.uuid) break return len(unique_vio_uuids)

commit_message:
POC - DB Backed Pools Config

Based on mid-cycle discussions, pep8 and py27 fails all over the place,
ignore for now. This is simply a rebase of the Mid-Cycle code over
current master.

Change-Id: I556e08cc56e1410baa602e469d01eecb260045b3

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/42/305142/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: description: > Administrator only. Lists server groups for all projects. For example: ``GET /v2.1/{admin_tenant_id}/os-server-groups?all_projects=True`` If you specify a tenant ID for a non-administrative user with this query parameter, the call lists all server groups for the tenant, or project, rather than for all projects. as follows: .. code-block:: javascript "block_device_mapping_v2": { "boot_index": "0", "uuid": "ac408821-c95a-448f-9292-73986c790911", "source_type": "image", "volume_size": "25", "destination_type": "volume", "delete_on_termination": true } description: > The date and time when the resource was created. The date and time stamp format is `ISO 8601 <https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601>`_ :: CCYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss\xB1hh:mm For example, ``2015-08-27T09:49:58-05:00``. The ``\xB1hh:mm`` value, if included, is the time zone as an offset from UTC. In the previous example, the offset value is ``-05:00``. description: > Text describing this extension's purpose. description: > The date and time when the resource was updated. The date and time stamp format is `ISO 8601 <https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601>`_ :: CCYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss\xB1hh:mm For example, ``2015-08-27T09:49:58-05:00``. The ``\xB1hh:mm`` value, if included, is the time zone as an offset from UTC. In the previous example, the offset value is ``-05:00``.

description: "Administrator only. Lists server groups for all projects. For example:
\ .. code-block:: json

 GET /v2.1/​{admin_tenant_id}​/os-server-groups?all_projects=True
\ 
If you specify a tenant ID for a non-administrative user with this query parameter,\ \ the call lists all server groups for the tenant, or project, rather than for\ \ all projects.

" description: "The date and time when the resource was updated.

The ``\xB1hh:mm`` value, if included, is the\ \ time zone as an offset from UTC.

commit_message:
Import RST files for documentation

This is the results of the RST conversion from WADL. It creates a
single index plus a bunch of included files which represent sections
of the API document. This is the starting point for fixing the
documentation.

Change-Id: I7d561c2ecdcd864172dedb54a551f17ad3bdfe26

added_lines: ============================================================================= Delete Assisted Volume Snapshot - OpenStack Compute API v2.1 ============================================================================= Delete Assisted Volume Snapshot ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ `Request <DELETE_delete_assisted_volume_snapshot_v2.1_tenant_id_os-assisted-volume-snapshots_snapshot_id_.rst#request>`__ `Response <DELETE_delete_assisted_volume_snapshot_v2.1_tenant_id_os-assisted-volume-snapshots_snapshot_id_.rst#response>`__ .. code-block:: javascript DELETE /v2.1/{tenant_id}/os-assisted-volume-snapshots/{snapshot_id} Deletes an assisted volume snapshot. To make this request, add the ``delete_info`` query parameter to the URI, as follows: DELETE /os-assisted-volume-snapshots?delete_info='{"volume_id": "521752a6-acf6-4b2d-bc7a-119f9148cd8c"}' This table shows the possible response codes for this operation: +--------------------------+-------------------------+-------------------------+ |Response Code |Name |Description | +==========================+=========================+=========================+ |204 | | | +--------------------------+-------------------------+-------------------------+ Request ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ This table shows the URI parameters for the request: +--------------------------+-------------------------+-------------------------+ |Name |Type |Description | +==========================+=========================+=========================+ |{tenant_id} |csapi:UUID |The UUID of the tenant | | | |in a multi-tenancy cloud.| +--------------------------+-------------------------+-------------------------+ |{snapshot_id} |csapi:UUID |The UUID of the snapshot.| +--------------------------+-------------------------+-------------------------+ This table shows the query parameters for the request: +-------------------+-------------------+--------------------------------------+ |Name |Type |Description | +===================+===================+======================================+ |delete_info |xsd:string |Information for snapshot deletion. | | |*(Required)* |Include the ID of the associated | | | |volume. For example: DELETE /os- | | | |assisted-volume- | | | |snapshots?delete_info='{"volume_id": | | | |"521752a6-acf6-4b2d-bc7a- | | | |119f9148cd8c"}' | +-------------------+-------------------+--------------------------------------+ Response ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^

commit_message:
Rebase on Tiers (2 of ?)

Recent pypowervm changes support removal of SSP-based storage (LU linked
clones and, if unused, their backing image LUs) from the Tier instead of
from the SSP.  (This confers the advantage of obviating etag mismatches
which require retries; such retries can continue to fail in a
heavily-loaded environment.)  This change set converts the SSP disk
driver's remaining SSP-based LU operation, delete_disks, to use
pypowervm's new Tier-based removal mechanism: rm_tier_storage.

Change-Id: Ibc75cca1feb20f1c83126b17cc7d76175a9ba8dc

added_lines: * Previously, when specifying ``heartbeat`` and ``handshake_timeout`` parameters in ``rabbitmq.config``, the default parameters disappeared. Now, all ``rabbit.* ``configuration options can be handled by ``rabbit_config_variables`` in hiera. See LP1560687 <https://bugs.launchpad.net/fuel/+bug/1560687>`_.

commit_message:
Update min_ansible_version to 1.9

This role makes use of the ternary filter which was only introduced in
Ansible 1.9, this patch updates the min_ansible_version to 1.9.

Change-Id: I942761b2039854f68323d7e99ce3d9405f6cc9c3

commit_message:
add combined parameters.yaml file

This is the output of fairy-slipper conversion, merged into a single
file, with some error collision put into place. This will require some
unwinding of content because of the collisions that exist in keys, but
that can be done manually post import.

Change-Id: I430ed66728a6ac009f23e6ff8a65a3ec01c21327

subject: Update interface_properties only when required
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-14 10:02:35.000000000', 'files': ['nailgun/nailgun/network/manager.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/objects/interface.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-web/commit/68a01e6d3ee2ec4459f29c57b1658a7f3f0288e0', 'message': 'Update interface_properties only when required

Root cause of the issue is a race condition that takes place
when processing of two API requests intersects.

These requests are:
update node info from nailgun-agent and adding the same node
into an environment.

interface_properties.dpdk section is updated on both requests.
So, it was possible that request from nailgun-agent that comes
during the processing of adding node into environment overwrites
dpdk.available property with wrong value (value that was there
before adding the node into environment). It is because the changes
made during addition of node were not committed before start of
processing the update request from nailgun-agent.

Now, update request from nailgun-agent will not overwrite this value
in such situation because no DB update will be performed when
no changes are detected.

Change-Id: Ica23cb2cfd3439d5bb4d51afa64095cf8256f6b6
Closes-Bug: #1564102
'}]
commit_message:
Update interface_properties only when required

Root cause of the issue is a race condition that takes place
when processing of two API requests intersects.

These requests are:
update node info from nailgun-agent and adding the same node
into an environment.

interface_properties.dpdk section is updated on both requests.
So, it was possible that request from nailgun-agent that comes
during the processing of adding node into environment overwrites
dpdk.available property with wrong value (value that was there
before adding the node into environment). It is because the changes
made during addition of node were not committed before start of
processing the update request from nailgun-agent.

Now, update request from nailgun-agent will not overwrite this value
in such situation because no DB update will be performed when
no changes are detected.

Change-Id: Ica23cb2cfd3439d5bb4d51afa64095cf8256f6b6
Closes-Bug: #1564102
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-web refs/changes/12/305712/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: dpdk_properties = interface_properties.get('dpdk', {}).copy() # update interface_properties in DB only if something was changed if interface_properties.get('dpdk', {}) != dpdk_properties: interface_properties['dpdk'] = dpdk_properties

Add initial spec file for oslo.db

added_lines: %global sname oslo.db Name: {{ 'oslo.db' | py2pkg }} Version: 2.6.0 Release: 0 Summary: OpenStack oslo.db library License: {{ 'Apache-2.0' | license }} Url: https://launchpad.net/%{sname} Source0: https://pypi.python.org/packages/source/o/%{sname}/%{sname}-%{version}.tar.gz BuildRequires: openstack-macros BuildRequires: python-devel BuildRequires: {{ 'alembic' | py2pkg }} BuildRequires: {{ 'Babel' | py2pkg }} BuildRequires: {{ 'coverage' | py2pkg }} >= 3.6 BuildRequires: {{ 'eventlet' | py2pkg }} >= 0.17.4 BuildRequires: {{ 'discover' | py2pkg }} BuildRequires: {{ 'fixtures' | py2pkg }} BuildRequires: {{ 'hacking' | py2pkg }} BuildRequires: {{ 'migrate' | py2pkg }} BuildRequires: {{ 'mock' | py2pkg }} >= 1.2 BuildRequires: {{ 'oslo.config' | py2pkg }} BuildRequires: {{ 'oslo.context' | py2pkg }} BuildRequires: {{ 'oslo.i18n' | py2pkg }} BuildRequires: {{ 'oslo.utils' | py2pkg }} BuildRequires: {{ 'oslotest' | py2pkg }} BuildRequires: {{ 'six' | py2pkg }} BuildRequires: {{ 'pbr' | py2pkg }} BuildRequires: {{ 'PyMySQL' | py2pkg }} >= 0.6.2 BuildRequires: {{ 'python-subunit' | py2pkg }} >= 0.0.18 BuildRequires: {{ 'psycopg2' | py2pkg }} >= 2.5 BuildRequires: {{ 'testrepository' | py2pkg }} >= 0.0.18 BuildRequires: {{ 'testscenarios' | py2pkg }} >= 0.4 BuildRequires: {{ 'testtools' | py2pkg }} >= 0.9.34 BuildRequires: {{ 'tempest-lib' | py2pkg }} Requires: {{ 'oslo.config' | py2pkg }} >= 2:2.3.0 Requires: {{ 'oslo.context' | py2pkg }} >= 0.2.0 Requires: {{ 'oslo.i18n' | py2pkg }} >= 1.5.0 Requires: {{ 'oslo.utils' | py2pkg }} >= 2.0.0 Requires: {{ 'alembic' | py2pkg }} >= 0.8.0 Requires: {{ 'Babel' | py2pkg }} >= 1.3 Requires: {{ 'iso8601' | py2pkg }} >= 0.1.9 Requires: {{ 'migrate' | py2pkg }} >= 0.9.6 Requires: {{ 'six' | py2pkg }} >= 1.9.0 Requires: {{ 'sqlalchemy' | py2pkg }} >= 0.9.9 Requires: {{ 'stevedore' | py2pkg }} >= 1.5.0 BuildArch: noarch %description The OpenStack Oslo database handling library. Provides database connectivity to the different backends and helper utils. * Documentation: http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.db * Source: http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/oslo.db * Bugs: http://bugs.launchpad.net/oslo %package doc Summary: Documentation for the Oslo database handling library Group: Documentation BuildRequires: {{ 'doc8' | py2pkg }} BuildRequires: {{ 'Sphinx' | py2pkg }} BuildRequires: {{ 'oslosphinx' | py2pkg }} BuildRequires: git %description doc Documentation for the Oslo database handling library. %prep %setup -q -n %{sname}-%{version} %build %{__python2} setup.py build %install %{__python2} setup.py install --skip-build --root %{buildroot} # generate html docs python setup.py build_sphinx # remove the sphinx-build leftovers rm -rf doc/build/html/.{doctrees,buildinfo} %check export PYTHONPATH="%{python2_sitelib}:%{buildroot}%{python2_sitelib}" export PYTHON="python -S" testr init && testr run --parallel %files %doc README.rst LICENSE %{python2_sitelib}/oslo_db %{python2_sitelib}/*.egg-info %files doc %doc html LICENSE %changelog

commit_message:
Support using internal network for clients

Openstack mostly defaults to using public endpoints for
internal communication between services. This patch adds
a new option use-internal-endpoints which, if set to True,
will configure services to use internal endpoints where
possible.

Change-Id: I170e5e1eef3d2e3bb28d37606a468328005609d0
Closes-Bug: 1456876

commit_message:
use correct manager for volume snapshots

the snapshot manager is volume_snapshots, not snapshots.

Closes-Bug: #1567895

commit_message:
Use get_admin_context() to create the context object

The current code uses RequestContext() call directly to create a context
object. Now this is changed to use get_admin_context() to create the
object.

Closes-bug: #1516812
Co-Authored-By: Vladyslav Drok <vdrok@mirantis.com>
Change-Id: I1235fe5feac4a9aa224599ca70def1434a3b9bcb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/36/246036/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: admin_context = context.RequestContext( user='admin', tenant='admin', is_admin=True)
